lPFctCqpMyhqyFS2JmYvVg.text: Are you kidding me with this place? The real deal Italian huh - oh you mean the place that features a giant microwave oven right in the middle of their prep area. I order a chicken cutlet hero and the next thing you know is the guy is picking up some patties or round things and tossing it in the nuker on a paper towel (just like at home). I say something about it and he is like "im just warming them up and then I'm gonna throw them down there" Down there was another oven below the microwave.    Whatever he had planned for those chicken cutlets I wasn't about to find out and hoofed it out of the place. Maybe places do nuke their cutlets, but this time I'm watching and I'm not eating rubbery chicken and they should ashamed of themselves anyway.     Romanelli's - 35 years of microwaving food. Manja people.

2org7MhntxhyyeBXWI72Sw.text: This place has awesome Italian butter cookies per the pound- I have not been able to find these in years, especially since moving to AZ. Love this place for that item alone.   I think the food is so so, really nothing to be desired, BUT the cookies keep me coming back!

1drP-qnTj9iB5im4ingaUQ.text: Amazingly delicious  very very good sandwiches and treats with smiling pleasant staff!  The Roberts special was my favorite but my husbands Italian stallion was really good too!!!  I wish I lived closer but I will definitely be stopping by for my Italian cravings when I need a fix or when I am in the area!!!  While we were leaving someone was walking out with a pizza to take home and bake!! It looked sooo good

l4f2XkAa5FcnQC9YbWMhlw.text: Stop by here to pick up some of the best garlic bread you can get! Pop it in the oven for 5 minutes at 400 degrees at home and enjoy with your homemade pasta. So good!

ctp2vbtLTt5CymB0zZpZvQ.text: One of the best service experiences I've ever had. Asked if I needed water when I coughed just once, kept asking if I needed help or suggestions, kind and patient people.   Oh, and the food? Definitely some of the best sandwiches I've ever had. Like wow. The smell is intoxicating. Can't wait to try more from them

QtekpLX2ryjYVOOFtih_iA.text: The food here is delicious. I haven't really found that great of a deli around here yet but me and a coworker have come here and thus far have been impressed. Their subs are tasty despite being a bit heavy on the bread side; and their chicken Parmesan is pretty good too. The service is quick and the speed at which they prepare the subs is lightning fast. The only downside is the prices, I mean they are not that cheap for their subs but if you get desert like cannoli then you're going to fork over an extra $3.00 per cannoli or $2.00 per cookie.. Oh well I will continue to come here and enjoy the food.

ZRvOrNquc03GU6wqwP7mpg.text: Used to love Romanelli's for their old world authenticity.  I wish they could merge the worlds a bit more and update their check out system.  If you pay by credit card they charge $1.50 on top of their pretty pricey items.  For a sandwich, drink and bag of chips to be $15.00 out the door - way too much.  The deli sandwich maker consistently forgets to put items on my subs.  I have to check two or three times to make sure every item I ask for gets on there.  This makes my sandwhich wrapping a mess!!!  I love their no frill Tuna Salad yet they don't always have it, you have to call ahead and make sure they are serving it that day, which makes spontaneous stopping by too premeditated for me.  Not a lot of great Delis in the North Vally area, i wish this one could have stayed as good as it has been for such a long time :(

x9hPwL96li1XYXFLtLxzng.text: Absolutely LOVE this place. Best sandwiches EVER!!!! Everything is so fresh & good. Been coming here for years, everyone is always nice & friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken parmigiana sandwich

4nSRdzXtm10AV_XnTn-G-A.text: Great sandwich and service! They also have a store and bakery with all the Italians ingredients and treats you need.

3gECaFxwb3G7kcTRPh5vGw.text: OMG! It tastes like Home! The Italian cookies, the Italian subs, the cannolis. Sooo good omg! Thank You for the Great Service. And Great food!

uhGF9zNsJYSwOmNOUaXoUw.text: Had exactly what I needed (Polly o mozzarella) Lots of it and then some... We also picked up some sandwiches and a pizza the sauce is amazing! They even have the little ones a cookie

ImvVnYQgXcVURojvNYZ0VQ.text: We stumbled upon this place and decided to try it. Such good sandwiches!! Best I've probably ever had. We've been there a couple times now. The people are friendly and the food is delicious!! It's fun watching them slice the cheese and meat right there in front of you!

6VCQqHKnHdujIfxB4x7_lw.text: Been here a few times now . I bring a new buddy every time . Trying to spread the word this place is legit.

6stJkE-SPj-47pf1t30LOQ.text: Authentic, old style Italian deli. Not many left but this is the place! Will only buy my mozzarella from them where they make it fresh! Fresh baked bread, hand cured meats, desserts....can't beat Romanelli's!

HvTLz1sHrHQCccKbvWeIIg.text: This place has been here for over 35 years, not a lot of time on the East coast. But, here in AZ where no building lasts for more than 60 years , it is astonishing! True right up front, it is in a rough hood. But, maybe you should just go during the day. The selection here in the Groceries is without comparison.  They have everything Italian you could want.....Imported from Italy. Of course. They make their own sausage there,(you can buy it in the meat case.)  It is by far, THE BEST we have ever had any where. It even drove the dog crazy when I just brought it in the house. The smell is so good!  The choices for the food and cook ware,as well as gifts are fantastic.  I have not been able to eat lunch there but ,next time we will. So far the first 3 times have just been Grocery shopping. I live just over 50 miles round trip from this Deli , Bakery. Every mile is worth it. I cannot believe I had never been here till October. I have since recommended it to every Italian I know. Oh yes, it is that good. If I could give them 10 stars ,I would.

i04zs9Dy6WdSKrY1Ta306Q.text: Everything was very good did the catering order with sandwiches and salads I would definitely recommend them you definitely get what you pay for.  This is far above your standard sandwich plate quality.

bYLEe7qgwjsJUCO0Ip7F1w.text: Excellent food, wonderful market and a deli full of delicious items...not to mention a bakery too! We had soup and sandwiches...perfection. We also purchased a loaf of bread and Italian sausages, some sauce and pasta. We fixed it later for dinner and the family loved everything. This is our new favorite spot. If you enjoy good quality food, this is the spot for you.

xqDyVtcJTXg8m-hCCHJYkA.text: All the five-star reviews pretty much covered this place, but I thought I'd pile on anyway.  The groceries, the subs, the house made olives, everything is great!   The mozzarella sub is absolutely amazing. If they would bring back seeded sub rolls I would be in heaven.

NfzGMcMPauxdhkn5LUCm4w.text: The cheesecake scrum delicious 6lbs definitely a place to go for authentic Italian. Chicken parmigiano hero the marina sauce and all the mozzarella cheese enough to feed two

FhezMxb7iWFwoEe4ICvpgQ.text: This place is awesome.  My boyfriend and I waltzed in early evening time, not knowing that they were closed and on their way to lock the door.  We both felt terrible and were going to leave but were INVITED to stay and order whatever we wanted!  They insisted!  I couldn't believe the hospitality and customer service.  Most places would gladly give you the boot and hurry home (not that I blame 'em!), but Romanelli's was different.  They even made conversation with us.  Another plus?  The hot pastas are DELICIOUS.  Side note:  They bottle their own pasta sauce!  We can't wait to go back.

k-7VB-FxveQZ5J-7A0qXCA.text: Today my husband and I had the distinct pleasure of eating lunch at Romanelli's Italian deli.  We ordered the lasagna, meatballs, a specialty sandwich, bowtie pasta salad, fruit salad, and a drink.  It was a wonderful feast!  We sat in the quaint, little dining area within the market area.  Besides the food being absolutely amazing, the owner, Sam, came over and asked if he could sit with us.  He has owned and run this establishment with his family for over 36 years and takes great pride in the food and service they provide to their customers.  He is one of the most endearing and lovely people we have met.  The market offers a wonderful variety of Italian food, wine, and other great selections!  I told Sam that when we walked into his deli I felt like I was in a little Italy!  We will definitely eat here again!  Highly recommended!

Dfc8F8mq81yJsWzSUPtgig.text: Authenticity = 5 stars Quality & Service = 5 stars Food = 4 stars   Listen, their food is fantastic I just happen to be a bit of a purist when it comes to reviews on yelp.  Only the best sub sandwiches in the world get five stars, everybody else gets four if they're really great.  I suggest trying their Italian Stallion and for desert the cheesecake.  Local tip... don't skip the oil and vinegar or ghiardineria on your sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Classic Italian Crocker with great eats!

lPej_FwVdf6i17kJ9Ma1uA.text: By far the best Italian Beef I have ever tasted. I have lived in my Condo for 5 years and married for 4. Never knew this place existed until my Brother in Law was introduced by his GF to Romanelli's and told us but we waited for almost a year.  Shame on us. But rest assured this will be our go to sandwich place.

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YD9SsL9y_xv2XyTgN0BXDw.text: We are from out of town and we're so excited to come across an authentic Italian food. Immediately they made you feel like one of the family. Can't wait to visit our new ASU student so we can come back for more.

fjCkd2YdmrvQDcA1AjhLYg.text: Went in to buy a Panettone bread. Smells amazing, I'd like to try some food next time I go in. Someone was leaving with tray after tray for some huge party - Wish I had been invited! :)  They sell cannoli shells and now I'm thinking I should try making my own soon

zEPsFMnV5dRsd3svaqXHPw.text: I was working in the area and decided to stop in for lunch. I was sold by the sign indicating they were voted New Times best Italian deli' I found the staff to be outgoing. And accommodating. I ordered chicken parm sub. The chicken parm portion was pre made...awhile ago....as the breading had a glue like texture.  I also selected 1/3 lb of Italian butter cookies @12.99/lb. The cookies were stale and I'm gonna guess they sat in a freezer for a good long time, as they possessed a very strong freezer burnt flavor.  Lastly, I ordered a plain cannoli. The cannoli was pretty D. good. The ricotta cheese was blended to a very smooth texture...yum! While I waited for my sandwich to be made I did a lap in the store to check out the imports. I did note the freezer stock does not appear to move. Lots of items showing signs of age in the refrigerator/freezer case, like rusty sardine cans and frozen pastas that are dried, cracked and tired.  I found that leaving the product in place combined with the other things previously mentioned left me with a rather negative impression. I did take note of the dried meats and aged cheese's, there was a large selection of what I assumed to be imported items, maybe I will stop in and try some capi-lami-chutto sometime in the future.

r11B3RMyHXzBbTKP7De9Fg.text: Sam and his brood treat customers like they are one of the family here.  I look forward to visiting Romanelli's whenever I'm in the neighborhood.   This place is a gem and a real taste of authentic old school Italian.  The cannoli was the best I've ever eaten.  The homemade sausage was absolutely fantastic as well.  I couldn't be happier to have this spot nearby, since my Italian mother doesn't live close enough to cook for me anymore.

qFzGRxj5ENxGlNiZ3SkL8A.text: Went here seeking food like I used to get on the East coast in New York Well it's not New York food but it was good and made to order or grab and go options Canollis were very good

jvDSPsdD-0j-czbvyuWt_w.text: Wish they had more fish options. But the sweets and meat look amazing! Cant wait to get home to try everything!

TI6Ycev6-5-R2gVBj68c4A.text: I am always on the lookout for a place to get decent lunch meat and Romanelli's is an awesome choice. I had a sandwich while waiting for my stuff to get cut and it was excellent. They had an awesome dry salami that I wish I could remember the name of. One of the guys said it came out of San Francisco. This place is worth driving across town to get to.

_jafwDRJ6-jt_0UDKZmigw.text: I stumbled upon this place on accident while working on the westside. I had George's Special.... Best sandwich I've had in a long time. I'd take a picture but it's all gone. Fresh ingredients, great staff behind the counter, and full of regulars. Highly recommended.

PeHXb4P9A-t_MVwt2oKEUA.text: Stopped in for lunch on a Saturday. We got a turkey sub and an Italian meats sub for $7.99 each. Great quality ingredients. The bread was the best part! The seating area was nice and clean.  This place has a full deli and bakery area. We left with a tiramisu and lemon bars, but they also had fresh bread, cookies and cakes! They also have a store area where you can buy specialty items like pasta.

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pastas!
Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Looked so good!!!

NOJ0PcMalMPymE2iel7Jow.text: I love Romanelli's!! The people who work there are great and the food is GREAT. What more do you want??? NOTHING. Perfect Italian deli. Buy dessert, buy sandwiches, buy sides, buy meat, buy pasta sauce. I've never been disappointed....besides when they are closed.

h8eZsXg9Kc4911InnJyUCA.text: This is my favorite place to buy the most delicious Italian pastries. You have to try the homemade cookies. When im in the phoenix arra I always stop by  because it is just delicious. Everytime i go im never dissapointed. They import alot from Italia, so stock up on olive oil and other ingridients to cook at home a homemade Italian diner.

UDGFYZlqs-5fbVBNYTsu0g.text: I came here because their website said that they carry Struffoli (Italian Honey Balls). I was extremely disappointed when I saw Romanelli's idea of struffoli - ping-pong size balls of dough covered with sprinkles and a little honey on the bottom of the pan. The real thing is a huge mound of marble-sized dough balls drenched in honey and sprinkles. Please don't advertise what you're selling as struffoli. Google it and you'll find recipes that will show you the real thing. If I didn't have a tiny kitchen and no time, I would make them myself.

SArHTyOWqdgHa9VrIOBV8g.text: I went into Romanelli's today for the first time at the recommendation from a friend. It smelled so good when I walked in! The lady behind the counter greeted me right away and could sense my confusion on where to place an order and pointed me in the right direction.   I ordered the Robert special and then ended up taking a lasagna home. The sandwich was phenomenal. Everyone was friendly and helpful.  It was pretty busy and I heard someone yell they needed more cannolis in the front and someone behind the deli counter yell back they would bring them up. It was pretty funny just listening to the banter back and forth. There is a pretty impressive selection of grocery items and frozen pastas as well as novelty items. When I was checking out I asked about the cannolis and asked her if she was related to the guy at the deli counter. She explained it is a family owned business and she's been friends with the family since grade school. I was told the cannolis are made fresh every day and she had run out and that's why she was yelling for more to be made. I asked about placing larger orders and was provided a menu so I could see what my options were.   I would definitely go back again even though it's out of my way but I can stop on my way home from work.

2uWIfxSXaPF_8QTTeM7-ig.text: 12/19  Delightful folks!  I wanted something special for Christmas Eve and with the help of Beth, I will have my special treat in time, in Prescott Valley.  When I go down to Phoenix, I'll be stopping in to Romanelli's, to do some shopping and say Hello.  I am so pleased!! Merry Christmas Romanelli's!!!!  PJS

9MMIwsOUwwG-T3Wq9kr1MQ.text: This isn't gonna be a long review. Just straight to the point. Amazing food. I've gone through most of this menu and everything is so good. It's a little pricey, I'll give ya that. But as hold True with most in life. You get what ya pay for.

Ib6quvhHcB32sMKIjlHMJA.text: Absolutely rude! I don't care how the food taste when there's disrespectful employees it leaves a bad taste in your mouth and it really makes you regret spending your money there...

wBEy6Lk32gCBPacb8Y66vQ.text: I've been going to this Deli for about 15 years and it's always great! Really nice, friendly folks too. It's very clean and actuall smells clean. Compared to the best New York Delis, Romanelli's is as good or better than any of them! It's also a bakery, restaurant, grocery store, gift shop, imported appliance store and more. They have actual San Marzano Italian tomatoes and Stanislaus "Alta Cucina" California grown copy cat San Marzano style tomatoes. You can't get either just anywhere. They also have a selection of Pasta machines too! I love this store!  It's also the only place (I know of) in Phoenix to get sausage casings! I always get some Olives while I'm there because they're the best anywhere. I'm glad I got plenty of real, fresh mozerella mini balls. I planned to make a nice pasta salad with fresh Mozzarella, Basil & Cherry Tomatoes, except the Mozzarella was so good I ate it all!!!! LOL Now I have to go again! A+++++

p5lXixpxdXiHksHwcJTknQ.text: Soo Good! Seriously the best Italian food place I have ever been to! Pasta, sandwiches, and desserts. Really anything you need to satisfy your tummy!

yInusFWXVkWjjZxR4nPhQA.text: Cannoli's. People, if you even THINK you know what a good cannoli tastes like, then you are sorely mistaken. Romanelli's hands down has the best cannoli's I've ever had.  Ridiculous!   The people who work here are so extremely friendly. I dropped in yesterday at 10 minutes til closing and I wasn't rushed at all. I ordered 2 sandwiches, a pound of the macaroni salad and made my way to the register.   I noticed they were all out of cannoli's but the lady behind the counter had 2 made up for me, THAT's customer service!   If you ever find yourself over by Metro Center and want a sub or even some baked zitti or lasagna go give them a whirl!

PioZjajIqBZh6A29829qEA.text: Sorry I just made this account even though I told the person working the deli I would leave a review the next day, it's been 3 months. Well I remember how it tasted. Amazing if you ask me. Four and a half stars if it existed. I would give five if it was a sole eatery so the atmosphere is split. Go here if you want some Italian goods and a fresh tasting sandwhich.

tzwhxE8TmQ5oXyMxvzDteA.text: Learned about this deli in December and finally made it there today. So glad I made it there. Had a Italian sandwitch and it was great. This is the first sandwitch I have had in 10 years that has great bread. Robert brought me out a meatball to try and it was great. The perfect mix of beef and pork with some breadcrumb and baked to perfection. My original intention for going here today was for the proper ingredients for dinner tonight. Found Nina brand tomatoes with basil and some fresh cheese ravioli. I drove nearly thirty minutes to eat and shop here and will be back many times. The retail section on its own is great with several olive oils and basalmics to choose from. The deli counter has the proper amounts of pancetta and fresh provisions. This place could be very costly if you go there hungry.

qPOHAB7dwvd52PVQiloiZA.text: I am a 100% Italian and have lived in the Valley since 93 and today was my first visit to Romanelli's.  Even though I live in North Scottsdale - I will now be a regular for the rest of my life!  I was hoping that they would have Easter Bread & Zeppole - I walked in and asked Robert and he quickly gave me the tour and the treats I was looking for.  I even added a sfogliatelle for tomorrow morning.    The meats, the sausage, the bread, the pastry, the cookies, the pasta the Italian baccalla, the fact that they told me to call ahead if I want anything special - this place is an Italian Food Lovers paradise!  I felt like I was back on the Hill in Providence!  My kids even had the Italian Ice and some cookies!  Buona Pasqua!

07D7xlpP5zzs15CN3AOavQ.text: Today must have been a bad day.  Went in to the store and it started like every other time we have been in the store.  Looked at the shirts, looked at the baked goods, then headed to the Deli Counter.  Saw a special on the glass.  any two different items 10.99.  I was not really interested in the meatball, lasangna, or Chicken Parm, just wanted some of their Italian Sausage.  So being it was 5:30 and they we closing in a few minutes I asked if I could get two of the sausages for the price of the special?  The very nice lady behind the counter said sure no problem.  So I began to    order for my wife son and I.  Ok I will have 2 specials,  My wife would like the Chicken Parm and the Meatballs, My son even though he is only 6 wanted the meatballs and the Lasanga, no worries I ordered the Meatballs and the Lasanga, and lastly I will have two Italian sausage.  at that point the not so pleasant fat, Short, guy from behind the counter yells they have to be two different things, then turns to the lady and states cant you read, how long have you worked here?  i began to explain and he yells again this time at me, If you want two sausages they are 6.99 a piece or you c an buy the at 5.49 a pound a take them home and cook them yourself.  I stated that if I wanted to cook dinner  I would not have come in.  he then yelled if you want us to cook them you can pay for them?  this was our cue to leave.  the poor girl behind the counter said she was sorry and he began to yell at her again.  As we got in our truck the girl came out and waved as she knew us from many past visits.  The food is ok at best however my wife being Italian liked the nostalgic feel of the place.  Now because of the rude behavior of the little fat man we will not be returning,  After 15 years we will buy our Italian Sausage elsewhere.

hxwKClHei9VzBkjLh2SAcQ.text: Drove from Surprise to get here.  We weren't disappointed!  Great Italian food - huge deli department.  Wonderful breads and pasteries.  Mouthwatering treats.  We'll be Back!!

FXqPoePY2azHpV0CsxHFcA.text: Im staerting to write extremely brief reviews of all the places I have been on the road.  this is my first review: wicked awesome deli/store great service awesome sandwich, with great bread.  I will be back. I'm pretty picky on my italina sandwiches, and this one worked very well.  if your looking for something authentic, go here.

z7SwECp4Fw-xLMiUTSMNSg.text: The subs are so delicious. The employees are very nice as well, great customer service.

XsPHNxeua4J55JwwUWHy9Q.text: WOW - I had Robert's special and it was delicious.  The chocolate cannoli is killer! Great staff and wonderful food.

Rja9DtApTBKvfBrT1DUJiA.text: This deli is the best I have had in the valley.We live in Chandler and have to drive 70mi round trip so it must be and we have tried many throughout the valley but none are as good. I will suggest the Italian stallion, it is awesome and huge as well. We enjoy this deli so much we are talking about taking a trip out there next Friday for lunch.We have visited half dozen times and have had only one issue with this nice little deli. The problem was not that big of a issue but did kind of tick me off. I had bought dinner rolls and when I got home pulled them out of the sack and they where hard as a rock.So always check for freshness before you buy anything from the bakery.There was one other little issue I had here when a gal working the front checkout counter was not pleased she had to work because she was not vary friendly at all and looked totally miserable.That was the only time I have seen her and hope I never do again, the main reason they did not get five stars from me. Other that that this place absolutely rocks dudes and is most definitely worth the 70mi trip.

vlQyTv-tCIfg_qAknWGmXA.text: This place has homemade Italian sausage, great sandwhiches, imported Italian meats and cheeses, a selection of hot daily specials for lunch and dinner, and that's just the back counter.  There also have a great selection of pastas, sauses, and a delightful array of jarred and canned goodies; everything from olives to grape leaves to tomatoes.  They are not open on Sundays, which has burned me once or twice, but that's the only negative thing I can say about this place.  Just try it and fall in love!

krRmaJnwjpocgIiFW55JVg.text: Amazing food and pastries. This has become my new favorite deli !! the home made sausages are wonderful . It has an old New York feel to it, so i felt right at home.

GJW7qIX7R8SoZm5kTmMY1w.text: This is a mixed review.  We drove about an hour to get some St. Joseph day pastries.  They were very good.  They had two kinds 1) with custard filling and 2) with ricotta cream filling.  We also  had lunch.  The meatball hero was amazing plus the turkey, roast beef and cheese hero was stacked high with ingredients and reminded me of being back east.  The grocery store has some amazing Italian pastas, drinks from back east and other amazing stuff to make a great Italian dinner at home.  The pastries were very good, I did not like the cake frosting on the chocolate eclair but the custard was very good not to sweet and the napoleon tasted very good as well.  The cookies I thought were a little over price @ $11.00 a pound and you only get about 6-8 cookies for that price.  I say this is a mixed review because I tried the baked ziti also and it was very very dry, tasted like it was a day old and the pasta sauce was very very acidic.  It actually made me throw up.  I originally wanted to try their pasta because I was looking to have them cater an event but after trying the very dry pasta which made me throw up I decided to use another restaurant.  The sandwiches and pasties are amazing. Customer services rocks. I would not go out of my way to go here but if I was in the neighborhood I would stop in just for the sandwiches and a yoohoo.

3QKJPls3JSv-J0XD7ulwbw.text: This place beyond rocks! I came in Saturday morning looking to got some things to make Italian Muffalalettas  for a Sunday tailgate. Robert Romanelli put everything together for me in about 25 minutes!!! Fresh bread, freshly sliced meats and cheeses, and he even recommended sides I even left with mini cannoli and Italian cookies. One of the best gourmet store shopping experiences I have ever had. I will definitely come back.

cOVZzIPxLmcaDxUAx1iT7g.text: Great deli and grocery.  They have easily the best maranara I have ever had on a sandwich or from a jar. The Romanelli's house maranara jars are $6, which ain't cheap, but once you've had it, you are ruined. The junk at the supermarket will never be good enough again.  No joke.  The sandwiches are great for eating in. The Italian bread is wonderful from the counter by the register to take home (especially with the maranara).  Really love this place.

C7QFJMvuqne5PmA5YFJUlA.text: Love it.  Last night I dropped into Romanelli's for the first time after driving past a time or two.  Glad I did.  It's a bakery and deli that offers a fine selections of meats, cheeses and breads.  They also sell all things culinary Italia.    When I stopped in it was 30-40 minutes to close.  I went directly to the deli counter for a sub and was met with a challenge as I decided which to try.  I opted for George's Special (ham, capicolla, salami, mortadella, pepperoni, provolone and hot peppers).  Given the close proximity to closing time I was expecting a sub on older bread that had been sitting around all day but it was still soft and very fresh.  The sub is easily the best I've had.  Amazing.  I also purchased a cannoli.  I'm picky about these things.  Too many places fill 'em and stock 'em and the filling makes the shell soggy.  Romanelli's fills them upon order just like the Italian bakery near a friends house in Newark, NJ (until last night the best cannoli I've had).  The cannoli was top notch.  Simply the best.  Right here in Phoenix, on one night, I had one of the best meals ever.  I cannot wait to return.  I only open they were open past 6pm.

NIXpfMKCkDMH8boTIqHx-Q.text: This is a great place to go for specialty items. I went here looking for unfilled canolli shells. There they were, right in front as I walked in. I loved that. I really don't like to ask where things are, so it was a bonus.   I wandered the aisles a bit, and listened to the conversation around the place. A woman was talking about being a transplant from Chicago, and the proprietor told her all about some of the products they sold that were specific from that area. I liked the atmosphere.  I liked the variety of products sold, especially the large selection of drinks and things like that. Pretty cool!  My only difficulty was getting out of the parking lot. Blah. I hate traffic, and this place is close to a busy intersection.   Other than that, no complaints!

dl1-yvF9ntkWmNRIfVjN_g.text: Delicious sandwiches! Amazing pastries! Must try

Ng1WSM-yPuhEK6oe398BsA.text: A nice selection of Italian groceries. They make a great deli sandwich with boar's head meats and fresh Italian bread. The cannoli is always good but I had a napoleon once I didn't like. The pasty and custard were too dry, not fresh. Lots of cookies and other goodies to tempt you.

gw1vKPUwUQx91V3CV0oJ_A.text: Romanelli's is great. I've been going there for the last five years and it's never let me down. I always go with the Italian Stallion with fresh mozzarella and peppers. It's a family owned business and the service is great. Rob, the owner, always remembers my order. For anyone looking for a real Italian deli in Phoenix, Romanelli's is your place.

Hq7brv4_DQQF-GunBNpvVQ.text: 5 stars to Rob and his family! What do I usually get here?  My wife gets the lasagna,  I get a nice hero, maybe chicken cutlet,  or a nice prosciutto and provolonewoth peppers.  Come for St Joseph's day and the whole week you can get the best stuffed zeppoles!!! FORGETTABOUDIT!  The pastries are the bomb. And the family and staff are the best. You can get cooking utensils, small kitchenware you won't find anywhere else,  italoan tshirts, frozen stuff to take home, hard to find canned goods....everything Italian.

xSRpCvMOEm_2GSDaFcyX_Q.text: AMAZING!!  I like to support local businesses when I travel and gladly drove the extra mile to find this local gem.  Was greeted immediately and escorted to the deli counter and given a terrific suggestion for a lunch sandwich.  I had the fresh mozzarella and prosciutto on a fresh baked Italian roll.  Probably the very best sandwich of my life!  On the way out I chose a $15 platter of Italian cookies to share with my colleagues and a cannoli (that one is all mine!).  Outstanding food and service all the way around.

dNQup5y1czbqOvhKC4B1tg.text: Visited Romanelli's today to pick up some San Marzano tomatoes which turned into a wonderful experience. It was around noon when I went so I figured I might as well get some lunch as well. I got the super sub sandwich and it had a good portion of meat and cheese on it. I believe it came with ham, pepperoni, salami, and cappicola and all of them had really great flavor. I also tried a cannoli which I really enjoyed. The cannoli shell had great texture and the filling was very creamy. My girlfriend wanted to try the limoncello mascarpone cake which was super moist and had a really great lemon flavor. As we were picking out which desserts to choose from, one of the workers was very nice and helpful and she also shared with us one of her recipes. The customer service alone is a good enough reason to make a visit here. They make you feel welcome and very comfortable and you can tell that they love what they do. Lastly, after we finished our meal another worker was handing out samples of their Italian sausage which was spicy and had really awesome flavor. I will most definitely be coming back for other great Italian treats.

b49LE9u_kPp9rSgWxxxsgg.text: Cannoli!!!!  No pictures because it's gone. First time ever coming. This place is legit. I'll be back.

NDly4W6_jczKNFrAGFflUg.text: This place has one whole aisle for canned tomatoes & a half aisle for peppers of all sorts Awesome deli.  I purchased dry pastas, buffalo mozz., lg stuffed shells, meatballs canned San Marzano tomatoes (makes ALL the difference) & Tirimasu & eclair

_4-k2zaq4NtQbaXsztRuCA.text: Maybe in the early 80's this was the coolest shnitzel in the 'hood, but now it's just plain spaghetto.  Really not impressed at all.  Tiny portions.  Mediocre quality, at best.    Too much bread($) for not enough meat(meat).  This place is riding on its reputation, but where it got its rep, i'm not sure.  If you're a fan, then hey, more for you.    I'm not coming back unless someone makes me an offer i can't refuse.

VC9M5mAMTU8g_kocGu9PrA.text: Everyone here is yelping about the deli stuff. Okay, it's a deli and bakery - I get it. BUT what you gotta come here for is San Marzano tomatoes. Not those SM-like/style tomatoes that are actually grown in USA (yes they have those too) but the real deal, grown near the base of Mt. Vesuvius. Look for the DOP stamp (its like a region-control stamp on French wines).  Oh yeah, pick up some imported pasta in shapes you've never seen or some pizza dough and fresh basil (it's in the deli case by the meats) and make your own sauce. BAM!  Don't forget the Torrone (nougat candy) or some Italian Ice/Spumoni for dessert if you aren't a big pastry fan.

AoqNEfDRi0wrG_TOMddYfA.text: Have been coming to Romanelli's for some time now. Have tried many items in their deli and bakery and each time it has been wonderful. Have had a few items from their hot food area, but it's not as good as the fresh made sandwiches. Their canolli's are fresh made and very yummy. The service is always great and the people are quite nice. Family owned and operated as well. Today I had capocolla on wheat with their deli mustard. Spicy! Also had a conolli to go with it. All in all, a very good lunch.

A6hng0FsDCRwl3N6zjTurg.text: I was going to give them another visit before reviewing but eh.. I got time.   The place is amazing if you are looking for grocery's, meats, cookies etc. It is an organized clutter of it all.   We went for lunch, which was good, confusing, and a bit $ for what I got. . The meats, cheeses and bread were all good but not OMG good. They seemed a bit lacking in substance believe it or not. LOL   I liked it, but I have not been back yet. HMM   I will try again!

tBqdHig6I6-ft2vvlFSlXA.text: I have been going here since the 90's. being an italian chick from NJ, it was a blessing when I found this establishment. I usually get the #7 sub or the sausage, pepper and onion sub. The bonus is that they have Wise potato chips and cannoli. Their cookies are tasty too.  We usually get a pound and finish half of it before we get home.  Nice selection of imported foods too.

U-mtLcCzP_YwNxdZ8DYbjg.text: Went there with the wife last week.  We've been there before and the food is always excellent but until now I've never done a review...my fault. I had a Georges Italian sub.  It just couldn't have been better! Period. Wife had her usual Sweet Italian Sausage w/ roasted peppers and stuff.  She adores them.   Everything I've had has been great but I won't ever order anything except a Georges again.  You can't improve on perfection.

Rez0YUdAAyrltSwyEu9g_Q.text: This is the most amazing little deli/bakery I have ever been to. The fresh made pastries, breads, meals... EVERYTHING is delicious!! The staff/family is so friendly and always makes you feel welcome. I recommend this place to EVERYONE!!! LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!!

zalOwp7q13Peejan_FTtrg.text: Right from the first few seconds I opened the door to Romanelli's, I felt like I was in a fairy dreamland.  I was immediately greeted by a beautiful display case of Italian cookies, which we (my husband and I) later went back and bought a pound of.  Then we followed our noses to the deli counter, where they had both hot food already prepared, as well as a menu of deli sandwiches. We decided to shop around a little bit first, since I wanted to buy a few items. We took our time wandering around the store, and after about 10 minutes on of the owners, Robert, came over to us to make sure we were okay. He then proceeded to take us around the store pointing out all the best ingredients and what I was looking for.  It was a delight! I stocked up on the basics like EVOO, balsamic vinegar, pasta, and bought my first can of San Marzanos. It was after the canned tomato aisle that my heart stopped. I literally turned around and almost peed my pants. I almost pee my pants just thinking about it. I spotted the pastry case, and contained within was a HUGE eclair that made my heart do a little flutter. So of course I HAD to get an eclair....and a cannoli and baklava. This was my first cannoli and will most definitely not be my last. YUM!!!!!!!  We then went back to the deli counter and ordered lunch. I had the Italian Stallion and my husband had the sausage and pepper sub. He was so impressed, that we ordered 2 links of sausage to take home with us!   Overall, this being my first time in an Italian deli and grocery, it was more of an experience than anything. The people were so friendly and helpful to the blonde girl from Phoenix. I clearly didn't know what I was doing but they have so much passion for their food and what they do, that they took the time to help educate me on Italian cooking and all the pleasure it brings. Even though it takes about 20 minutes to get here from my house, I will definitely be going back.

5THxESpNhvCpQ4Ig7XWKjg.text: If your a NY/NJ transplant to Phoenix and miss the Italian Bakery & Deli that you took for granted in your old neighborhood then rest assured because Romanelli's will make you feel like your back home.  Great cold cuts and subs.  Everything high quality.  Amazing homemade Italian sausage.  You got your Polly-O cheeses like back east and Wise potatoe chips and cheese doodles.    Everyone mentions the Canolli and it deserves it.  I am not sure its the best I have ever had but its up there and they will get you fresh ones upon request with no hassle.    Everything is fresh and everything is delicious and for a NY/NJ transplant it is a refreshing spot when feeling a little homesick!    They even got great freshly baked Italian cookies and breads.    Thank God for Romanelli's!!!

hqrhYX9TivIMVkEjlvSQ9w.text: Ate there forc the first time and my sandwiches were awesome. So much better than subway. I would send my friends and family there

nK_Fy6dS5r5W4WoW_pCE2Q.text: Romanelli's is by far the best Italian spot I've found. Their food is amazing and fresh while their selection in the grocery aisle can't be beat. The employees lend to a genuine family feel, and are always so happy to see you. And the dessert case -- mmm mm mmm.. doesn't get much better than that! My only complaint would be their limited hours, but that's just because I wan't Romanelli's at all times of the day and night.  I've recommended Romanelli's to every person I possibly can. 10/10 would eat again... and again (and again)

AxpI3V7iDPaFRXbtITkmOQ.text: Just like back home!! Polly-O. If you don't know, you're going to need to go find out!

DloBQ0tfEOa5t-zmKsmdGQ.text: I cannot believe how rude and sexist the owner and his son are.  As a female I am personally offended by this place.

yW8BWD52s1-WKw1L3Aw1zg.text: I've heard about Romanelli's and driven by but yesterday I stopped in for lunch. I ordered the meatball sandwich and my husband ordered Italian beef. We did the combos so we chose pasta salad. The meatball sandwich was amazing! The bread was perfectly toasted and the meatballs were flavorful and solid. My husband loved his Italian beef. He's from Chicago so he's a snob about Italian beef. His favorite in the valley so far. We were so impressed that we ordered the take home meal from Romanelli's for dinner. The dinner serves 2-3 people.  You can choose from baked ziti, spaghetti,  chicken parm. There is another option but I can't recall what it is.  We chose the chicken parm. The meal comes with a salad,garlic bread & spaghetti w meatballs.  $24.99 is reasonable for dinner. Spaghetti, meatballs & salad was perfect. Chicken parm  wasn't that great. The chicken seemed too thick & their was no flavor in the breading or chicken.  Oh well, I just won't' order the chicken parm next time. If you want  authentic Italian beef, tasty meatball sandwich, need a cannoli or want a large jar of hot peppers, Romanelli's is your place. Next on my list, pizza & cold sub's...

CQf2pGFp7FjVSHYyyCyRXw.text: First time visitor today and was so impressed! Food was delicious (can't wait to try other things as well!). Their cookies were a big hit with the family.  My kinda place - will for sure be back!

SG93j9YGIvhHHAmUMVZMkw.text: Born and raised in Philly, long time resident of NJ, work and leisure in NY, and I can honestly say that I would put this place at the top. Great experience in every way, the food was delicious, store was impressive, and staff outstanding! Hot and Cold dishes,desserts and take away best in the state

F9BV1Z40vtivRkw4ug9nGQ.text: OUR NEW FAVORITE!! The staff is always nice and the food.... omg the food. Best sandwiches around!!  (Robert's Special and the traditional Italian sandwich are our go-to's) And cannolis that are diet breakers hahaha so delicious. I'd give six stars if I could -- just sayin'

3SqC4UVATF6fXPPldOzUQw.text: You can't get a fresher sangwich in Phoenix!  All meats, cheeses and especially the roll are top quality and made fresh.  I wish I could finish the 10" sub!

Z5Odrmk871nQZgBD_ti1vQ.text: 4.5 Stars.  Meatball sandwich week?  I was craving another one today and decided to head down to Romanelli's.  It's only a few exits down the road from work and the reviews seemed pretty good!  I walked in and placed my order for a Meatball Sandwich.  (The going rate for a meatball sandwich in Phoenix is about $9.00-10.00).  Total was just under $10.00.  I paid my ticket at the register in the front of the store and then grabbed my sandwich. Here is how it was.........  Meatball Sandwich-  This was excellent!  They take a loaf of home made bread, slice it up right then and there, pile it with about 6-8 meatballs halves, top it with cheese and then pop it in the toaster oven!  The end product was great!  The bread was toasty, yet soft when you bit into it.  The meatballs had great texture and consistency, the cheese was melted perfectly, and the sauce/gravy they use is awesome!  It was a thicker sauce and was flavored perfect...not too sweet, and not bitter either. Overall, just a damn fine meatball sandwich!  Might be the best one I have had so far in Phoenix!  Overall, I was impressed!  The place is family owned and they have been open for over 40 years.  They have a deli counter as well as a whole little store with all sorts of Italian goodies (Sauces, bread, peppers, olives, cookies, etc). They have plenty of seating, too!  I will definitely be back to have another meatball sandwich and try out some of their cold subs as well.   Service was very friendly and while I was there, it seemed like lifelong, repeat customers kept coming in to grab something to eat.  Good stuff!

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Meatball Sandwich.  It was delicious!
Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spread eagle shot of my meatball sandwich ;-).

zKtx-zmD-TuuLbwqNdrybg.text: Love this place! anything you need that's Italian! If your going to shop, take the time to grab a seat and enjoy one of their great sandwiches. Friendly staff and owners!

cerIRGU7cR5DapsEJjgxDQ.text: On the day I went here for lunch with a colleague, I talked about how sick of the city I was during the drive over.  Then we walked into this place at a strip mall and it felt like I was transported to a small town grocery store that could have been in my rural hometown back east or even in Italy.  The family establishment vibe permeated the entire trip.  The service was very friendly.  And the food is amazing.  I could eat lunch here every day. It is very difficult to choose what to order because it all looks so good.  I had the sandwich special of the day, and it was fabulous. My colleague shared her potato salad with me and It was the best I've ever had.  I would like to go back and shop for deli meat and sausages.   When we checked out, an older gentleman in front of us was moved to sing a song in Italian to the clerk after commenting on how the store reminded him of his youth.  My colleague got a bunch of cookies and treats to go.  They were consumed rapidly by our office mates upon our return.

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States

WMnEr5IHo0EvYsxesrBZEw.text: My boyfriend always talked about how amazing Romanelli's deli was and I didn't believe him until he took me. Let me just tell you, their subs are the absolute BEST! Nobody in Arizona compares to Romanelli's. Not only are their subs amazing, their pastries are also the most authentic tasting you will find. Their clean facility is also a huge plus.

vZu2MhqwkmyJKieK7LI3Qg.text: Just by walking into Romanelli's I knew I was going to enjoy my lunch. The fresh baked goods smells fill up the deli and it is amazing. I had the #7 Italian Stallion - DELICIOUS! The bread was baked to perfection. The meats were cut fresh from the deli display and you could tell. I would high recommend Romanelli's to anyone that is looking for an authentic italian sandwich. I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Italian Stallion and Macaroni Salad

AfPczQD90jKrABmxUAL1hQ.text: This place has and sells great restaurant quality food to the public.  Awesome pasta sauce for anything and everything to make at home for your family.  Hot meatball sandwich at deli is the bomb!  Only downside to this place is the price.  Nothing at this store is a deal.

BnxstbLlpktwFa7FLTNrCA.text: Never been to a True delicatessen but if this place is it,  which it has to be,  then we struck gold.  This place is outstanding and amazing.  The deli counter is food heaven,  with hot and cold items ans things never seen before.  So many things offered you have to see to belive. If this place isnt authentic than I don't know what is,  there were litterally Italian men sitting down have a causal chat in the restaurant.  We had a caprese salad and sub.  Both were absolutely over flowing with goodness. The Italian bread was a little hard for my taste so I would recommend a softer bread. Definitely need to go back to try their other dishes.  What and amazing find!!

nc3ESKBgfj-zRlTKDnHlcQ.text: What can I say other than this place is just amazing !  Been coming here for lunch for the past yr and a half. The service is beyond exceptional. And the food omg delicious. My go to sammich is the New Yorker or the Roberts special.

DuP7xO78wKalRKUS35v5Sw.text: OMG! Went here for our annual Christmas purchase of obscene quantities of Italian cookies. Decided to have lunch while there with the family. 3 had the lasagne, one had italian beef sandwich and the other a cold cut sandwich. All of these were amazing! The folks that work there are the best. I really cannot say enough about the place. This is a cooks paradise with a wide ranging assortment of ingredients for the discriminating cook. They also have the real Spumoni!! Hard to find!  Go here. You will love it!

WQ5d7lRCVnaEAxLfrjA9Hw.text: We stopped for lunch. Service was quick and friendly. Food was fairly good but nothing I'm rushing back for and, honestly, if I was in the area, I'd probably try somewhere different.   I got eggplant and spaghetti. It needed more flavor but overall good. My husband got a sub but I honestly don't know which one. It's really hard to find a good sandwich in the PHX area.   Fairly clean. Nothing fancy. Neighborhood is sketchy.

F22tA4QEnL2ftBw_Fo1kpg.text: Went in Saturday 8/4/18 . Was my first time. I am 5 months pregnant and was craving a cannoli. Owner was really nice. Went to the back to order 4 subs to bring home. The older heavy set man in the deli was so rude. They made me 5 subs when I asked for four. Then he  acted like it was my fault. Tried saying I had to buy the fifth one. There was another lady behind me. She mentioned that was her first time too. She actually left and said she wasn't going to deal with that kind of treatment. I Found another Italian bakery who's Owner and ALL the staff is nice and respectful. Won't be going back to this place.

phwuqk8SoCpOiI_Ipou3ZA.text: Meatball sub ohh my - their house made bread is fantastic and the hot peppers! Love coming here anytime in the area.  And the Carollo's for the road - yes please!

8Ru_8aX3hyjAWJ4-HcycnQ.text: I love romanellis. I have been coming here for years. Always good and fresh. That know how to make it here.

JOAVxM3hufMWXxriRXu8dg.text: Amazing food and service!!! Extremely high quality products. Will definitely be returning

frw32ZZ9KKz5x2UrL9YU4A.text: This place is the best deli in Phoenix I'm never disappointed you can't go wrong with anything in this store from the subs to the deserts it's all yummy in the tummy.

docrMGXFba4ywLSJwG1bGw.text: This place is absolutely amazing. I'm from Boston and I love my Italian food, this reminds me of moms cooking back home. Initially when I walked it I was greeted with a smile and ask if I needed any help at all. The initial walk in is kind of overwhelming because there is items everywhere, they also have a deli in the back that I didn't notice until I got done walking down all the isles of great Italian products. I saw the meatball sub, now I absolutely hate meatball subs from anywhere I.e firehouse subs, cousins, subway, etc.. so I was hesitant, but I gave it a go and oh my god. This sub was absolutely amazing, I live pretty far from this location, but if I am ever craving a sub again I will certainly be coming back here. The bread was toasted to perfection, I don't like Mariana sauce but this was the best Mariana sauce I have ever had. The meatballs were great the cheese on top. Hands down the best meatball sub you can get in Phoenix. You can also get their lasagna and order it ahead of time before you come in. The cannolis are awesome as well, made to perfect and by hand scratch. I will never shop at any other deli I will be very strong supporter of this place!

plYb5VOpdTtUVtVC3wF51A.text: This place is freakin awesome. The sandwiches were so delicious and the cannoli's did it for me. They were the best cannoli's I've ever had. MY wife and I will be going here for as long as we live in AZ.  On top of that, the people who worked there were extremely friendly. Trust me, you won't be disappointed.

dvYpSxl0pFSI-nYFKXi3RQ.text: Arizona is in desperate need of more delis.  Romanellis is one of the best.  I picked up some spicey homemade Italian sausage, fresh parmesean cheese, and fresh baked french bread the other night and made some of the most delicious pasta I've had in a very long time.  If you are looking for an Italian deli in Phoenix that has a wide variety of goods this is the spot.  You will pay much more here than you would if you went to the grocery store but you will not be getting the same authenticity.  Seems how great Italian delis are hard to find in AZ it comes down to Economics 101 - supply and demand.

yF3M554hmAu5c2M4Lc3nzA.text: are you joking? Where else can you get the best salami, ham, any cold cuts anywhere? I just moved here 6 months ago and have been searching for a place like this. Their meats are fantastic. I discovered this place after driving by it so many times. thought I'd take a chance. Location is awful. but worth the trip.

JMYatUkk40VJv6lqzTqjnQ.text: I went here a couple of weeks ago when I was in the area shopping for a new Bento box. I picked up some subs for dinner, along with a few items I haven't had since I've moved out here from New York.   I got the italian beef special, and the boy got some sort of italian meat masterpiece. Mine was delicious, and he seemed to really enjoy his. I also got a bag of wise potato chips since I haven't had them in FOREVER. YUM. (I also got an assortment of italian cookies, because seriously, who doesn't need some delicious rainbow cookies in their life?)  Overall, this place is awesome. The men behind the register were hilarrrrious. The woman behind the cookie counter was really helpful, but totally evil because she was steering me towards all sorts of delcious goodies that I shouldn't be eating.  I will definitely be going here again when I get a craving for some New York subs. Mmm.

tpcMWmxOKQHxhnvP3Btv8g.text: To start: this is not the place to go if you are looking for a Subway or Blimpie sandwich, so if that is your idea of what is "good" you won't like the experience here.  Good sandwiches (try the George's special which is the Italian Stallion referenced by others plus a couple other meats including mortadella and hot peppers) or the pastrami that they get shipped direct from New York.  They have their own off site bakery, so try some of their breads (the ciabatta is especially good) or cookies: the butter cookies are a bit hit or miss, but the rainbow cookies that they keep in the back are nearly to eastern standards.  However, the real star of the show is the sausage that they grind daily, along with the selection of certain specialty items: 30 year old balsamic, San Marzano tomatos and Mancini peppers anyone?

Bip5MEWIM0ALcPjty12BrA.text: It's impossible to walk out of here without dropping $50. From the great hoagies, to the best sausage I have ever eaten, I love this place. It reminds me of home. Real chopped cherry peppers, sweets, sabrett hot dogs and onions. I love the joint.

o5Qw4z9Ww1QpUXKs2QdspA.text: Ahh, this place is refreshing.  Smells like italy as soon as you walk in.. (ok, never been, but that's how it better smell).  We had lunch there, a chicago style italian beef and it was fantasic.  It's also a market, so, needless to say, I enjoy grabbing a quick bite in places that are a bit unconventional.. and, as I sat there eating, I looked at some italian antacids that kind of looked like screws or something that were bottled on the shelf next to me.. :/  Anyway, I also bought premade cannoli shells, which were a bit pricey, but to make my own it would have probably cost more..  AND they had the filling to purchase as well..  This was pretty neat to me.  Really though, this place has anything and everything you would need to make any italian dish, and the services was exceptional..

D0xpD7ydInq2brOFrTjZnw.text: The best italian deli I've been to in Phoenix.  As soon as I walked in the smell reminded me of deli's back home in Phila/NJ.  YUM YUM YUM!

DpCnzMii1KFesmvQKCILLA.text: This place is fantastic. I went there and had the Itallian Stallion and it was fantastic. I loved the family atmosphere and all the custom itallian ingredients available in the deli. It was great service and fantastic food for a good price

1ByOgjPmiZF60fZyB2gwtw.text: The meatball sandwiches are big, and very good. I like mine with extra sauce. That's the only sandwich I've tried but it's because it's so good I haven't gotten around to the others. And when you walk into the shop there's a big case of Italian butter cookies which are very fresh. I recommend the ladyfingers that are partly dipped in chocolate and fresh coconut.

dURjOtFlcVUYM_IpxDCHdg.text: This place's Pastrami is as amazing as anything in NYC.  The canoli was also loved my girlfriend.

YhhUHjgUAXI9BrgqhUOwAg.text: the smell as u enter is enuf for me to know mmmmmmnewyork. everything else proves it, too. everything u never knew u needed and all u ever want.

Mzxdy8fMzSBVDAdexfbvvQ.text: Live close to this place and have driven past it a lot. A friend and I went in after another place was closed. This place is great. They have a lot of pastas, sauces, olives, desserts, etc that you can buy. The deli has some great selections as well. We went in for lunch and we both got the four cheese lasagna! It was amazing! The sauce was delicious and the ricotta so creamy. The portion size was huge and we got garlic bread that they made (also fantastic)!

xI_yCmrlv5B6jV9zawTUXQ.text: As a Chicago native, you need certain things for making Italian beef.  Romanelli's has 'em!  They aren't the cheapest,  but beats paying to ship jars of giardineria out :)  Their sub rolls are very good too, haven't tried much else but I'll be back.

ms6UztzcpeGTZTVqxbo4hQ.text: We walked into Romanelli's just as it was closing, but the service there was outstanding. We eyed the pastries and ordered a lobster claw, chocolate eclair, and a cannoli. The staff assured me it was no problem if I wanted to order more cannoli's, it was no trouble at all to go and make more. I declined on their offer, but appreciated the gesture! We couldn't wait to go home to eat them, so we went into the parking lot and scarfed down our delights. I bit into the lobster claw - a perfect mixture of custard and flaky buttery pastry. Check Romanelli's out, it's been there for decades, and it's no wonder why, their food is delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eat the lobster claw!!

AyzCsbcngG9GUMb9I617Ww.text: Coming from New Jersey finding a good Italian deli was as easy as driving 5 minutes away. Here in Arizona I've checked out some of the other "Italian delis" and most are mediocre at best, including the ones in Scottsdale. Romanelli's has that old school deli feel, good selection and knows how to put a sandwich together.

8Ju_2_9RcNAIhDBAcq2cUg.text: Been going here for the Italian sausage for over ten years, very good product. However, I am so tired of the owner and his smug son. The deli sandwich prices are way too expensive now. Th ey also don't have the good crispy bread they use to have. How can panera have better bread than an Italian place? I was there last week and noticed some ordered pretty bake pizzas, so I bought a couple and they were pretty bad. Their  warm lunches are good, however way too expensive. If ya need sausage foe the bbq I would go, if you want lunch take a pass.

OD-uV8xEj63tRZntcFrDew.text: Oh my gosh these sandwiches are out of this world delicious.  I'm ashamed that it took me so long to try this place.  It's not just the sandwiches that are good but the salads and desserts, too!  Everything, is delicious.  You can tell this place is the real deal because they make food like the love doing it.  My favorite sandwich is the proscuitto, yum!

_G_QgAyIicVBYpsXQzNbTA.text: I can't believe how many times I flew by this place and never gave it a thought  Great sandwiches made fresh, great service, and you should really try the desserts! I'll be back

5JhzjJvhkLuzu9mgkhbElg.text: Great True Italian deli! Everything from meats to cheeses, a fully stocked sandwich counter with both hot and cold selections and even pizza! Full Italian grocer as well and don't forget to grab a cannoli or two on your way out! I go here at least once a week now for lunch!

zC5xwdoE0FjX_S0UPSJ-wg.text: I took my other half for a Birthday lunch and shopping experience. My other half is born Brazilian but to 3/4 Italian family.  What can I say... He was very happy in the store... Pointing out things that he has not seen since in Brazil, in his families supermarket/deli.   The food was really really good. I inhaled my 4 cheese Lasagna, where he could not finish his . Meet an owner I believe, she was super sweet and showed us around store. We even talked coffee and pasta!  Yes we will be back, I love Local business, especially if they good!    Thank you!

vK-H4h5PQH_GUvpp91DiCA.text: I have been away from NYC since 1996 and have never been here before. What a blast from the past a real Italian Deli. I had the George's hero it was outstanding. I felt I was back in the Bronx. The smell once I entered the deli was unbelievable.  They say smell is one of the strongest senses we have that bring back memories.  Not only was it a deli but a store that you can buy Real Italian products. Then to top it off the store has a bakery. Then the best was Frankie singing our favorite hits. Doesn't get any better than that.

U2nHpjeNfDqNb6W2LkJbYg.text: Today was my first time here, as my co-worker & I went here to pick up lunch to take back to the office after finishing up a graphics installation nearby at Grand Canyon University. From the outside, this place looks like a 60's-era thrift store-type building. You walk inside, and it's an actual Italian store, delicatessen, and eatery filled with all things Italian...from the food, to the clothing, knick-knacks, and souvenirs.   I ordered spaghetti and a medium-sized soda and my co-worker ordered the George, which was a 10' sub with all kinds of lunchmeats, cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, and onions, also vinegar and oil and oregano. It looked and smelled wonderful! He got it as a combo with chips and a large drink.   When we went to pay at the register, my co-worker picked up a box of yummy Italian cookies of all types to take back to have for when we get "sweet munchies". All said and done, the lunch was about the price of your typical dinner entrees and dessert. Not too shabby.   The ambience of this place was really wonderful and the owners were very, very friendly and hospitable. This is a "Mom & Pop" business and one I would gladly visit and buy meals and goods from over and over. The shop is located in a small strip mall at the intersection of Dunlap and 35th Avenue in Phoenix.   I HIGHLY recommend this place when you are in the Phoenix area.

YIGEuAFG28Jz7U5akw2UEA.text: Love, Love this place. I've been going for years and noticed I never reviewed it. You can't go wrong with the sandwiches they are divine. My favorite is the George's Special - cured Italian meats and peppers. I always get the hard crust bread which is great with the oil dressing, bread gets soft not soggy. I've had several of their sandwiches and they are all amazing. The meatball sub is out of this world. I do wish they had a better selection of cold salads, but eh they are still better than anything you would get at a traditional grocery store. The napoleons are also amazing. Lots of custard.

xMEqBMhfIzdb43ac24mYpQ.text: If you are a fan of the Subway Chain or On- Cor Frozen Dinners this is the place for YOU!  My husband tried the recommended George's Special. It's almost an Italian Style Hoagie. The quality of the meats aren't as bad as Subway but it was pre-portioned and made possibly days in advance and is all old and squashed together. They apologized to us and said they didn't have their normal rolls. The roll they had when we were there was a squishy roll that fell apart. The sandwich was dressed with a not so tasty dressing.  But on the bright side they do have hot peppers as an option.  They offer a sandwich of the day and also have a special board. The special of the day was Eggplant Rollatini. I thought that sounds good I'll try that. They all start running around and maybe five minutes later they tell me they are out of Eggplant Rollatini and my husband spots them pulling out from the freezer a big plastic frozen tray of them.   So I go for the Sandwich of the day. It was corned beef on a roll. I asked them to put it on rye instead because that would taste better. They asked me if I wanted it cold or warm and I answered warm please. The people working seemed very confused making my sandwich. They toasted my bread and popped the corned beef in the microwave. It was a very generous portion of corned beef but it was a mediocre quality. I tried a side of cole slaw and it seemed very processed.  I saw chicken parmesan patties under a heat lamp and they looked like they were formed and processed just like those On-Cor Frozen Dinners that I remember from my childhood.  My husband purchased some of their house made Hot sausage. He cooked it as soon as we got home. He said it had a good flavor but it was unusually dry.  I would never come here again to eat anything but the store here is above average for an Italian Deli place.  1.5 Stars Rounded up for the store.

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The George&#39;s  Sandwich
Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Special of the day sandwich with an added side of cole slaw

unrTkpbBgAwxvJ7BlgiSjA.text: I love the pastries here and have been getting zeppoli here for St. Joseph's Day for maybe the past 5 years. Even though they normally make them over the weekend before the holiday, they made mine early this year because I wanted to bring them to work today. It's that kind of willingness that makes a great business even better! Thanks folks, happy St. Joseph's Day :-)

GodCOLbTALzpImT-kbwTzA.text: Great food, great service, great selection of italian groceries. I need to add more so yelp will make this a post but i said everything i needed to say. What's wrong with short and sweet?

eiKYJzcLLy6RGRz0l-8acA.text: This review maybe a little impartial and maybe a little miss placed. Mainly because I only had one item from here. The cannolis but I will say they are amazing. They certainly made me wanna come back and try there other items.

CBDaZE6YgVe9Z-MwrjC07A.text: Yasss!!! Love that it's a family owned and loved the atmosphere inside. Sub was great!!! I will be returning, their cookies you buy on the pound. They had cheesecake I was drooling over.  They have a large selection of food from subs to pasta and and is worth every penny. Don't let the area change your mind.

ZIYofcDlJG15mWxflVkNAw.text: Bought some baked goods.  Very good.  All of the staff here or friendly and helpful.  I didn't try any of their sandwiches.  Probably worth it.   I thought their canned goods, tomatoes tomato paste etc were outrageously expensive.  I go back to get the Italian sausage pepperoni etc. but absolutely nothing else.  Way overpriced.  It was a nice deli though parking a little tight even though they had several spots.   Nice deli feel about the place

M-ZPMHKfsi8PZI53PZoeqA.text: First time for Christmas 2016, place was hopping  staff are great and friendly and and most of all helpful  got people through fast. My order for lasagna was ready to go ,I added a couple sandwiches to go at the last minute at check out staff notice I was handicapped and were more then willing to assist me carrying my order out to the car. Beth was fantastic! The best part was the smell of Italian food cooking and warming and listening to other customers picking up cannoli orders. Btw, my sausage/peppers&onions and my wife's No. 21 sub were outstanding, I'll be  Back!

K9nuhJrFJkD5Lp6wRTqmsg.text: Such a great spot. The deli is super helpful too. My daughter has a sever dairy allergy and they took the time to check ingredients for me. So helpful.

WmDcCsEJ9eZLMNa0-YytCg.text: " If you like my meatballs, you're gonna love my sausage."... they sell T-shirts and aprons with that saying on it. My point? It's a very fun and casual spot. The Italian grocery part of it is one of a kind in Phoenix. Whether you are looking for jars of sweet roasted peppers, Lupini beans, stuffed finger peppers, olive oil, wine or any other Italian delight, this is the place to come. The pastries are fresh and delicious here as well, if you love Italian cookies you got to try this place. I saved the best for last of course. THE DELI, they understand the simple fact that most people miss. Quality delicious food comes from quality delicious ingredients. They don't skimp here, not on the bread, the meat, the cheese or anything. My favorite sandwich is called "Roberts's Special", it's the perfect combination of roast beef, pastrami, provolone, tomato, mayo and onion, served hot. Add the hot or sweet giardiniera and you have the best sandwich around, in my humble opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Perpetuating Italian stereotypes since 1972!

_t8J0RXuHptZwJsr_LbCPA.text: I have only had sandwiches from here but they are really good. I really like the bread. The ingredients inside the sandwiches are fresh and tasty.

a_yjsVuzqi8XcgW28cX_BQ.text: Annoyed at the customer service I received yesterday and today. Yesterday I had to come into the deli to check to see if that had a whole tiramisu. Upon arriving there were no employees in the front the help me for almost 7 minutes I wandered around the store Hoping someone would come up to the counter. Finally someone assisted me and told me the price of the smaller tiramisu that they had. The employee gave me the price of 28.99. I left the store without the tiramisu.  I decided that night I would go back the next day and if they had it still I would buy it.    I returned the next day with my husband and told the gentleman that I was back for the tiramisu and chuckled. He couldn't find a box for it so they used plastic wrap all around it.. when he rung me, he rung me up for 39.99. I stopped and looked at him surprised and said that is not the price both the gentleman told me the previous day. So the man at the front went to the back to get the man that told me the price and right off the bat before I even said anything he was yelling and telling me that I was wrong and what the price is. ( mind you I was being very polite ,not arguing with them, no attitude, just letting them know what they told me the previous day)  just rude in my book.   Bottom line Romanelli's fix your damn phone line so I can call instead of wasting my time two days on a row at your store! And don't yell at people when I literally did nothing to deserve it. Thanks!

bhP-OFqhbL61ci-gck3grw.text: Just like home  I am originally from back east and it can be a real challenge to find a good Italian Delicatessen in Arizona. Unless you stop in at Romanelli's, this Delicatessen is the real deal.  I have stopped by Romanelli's a few times for lunch and I have never been disappointed. The aroma when I entered always brings back memories of back home. They even have small market, with hard to find delicacies.  Romanelli's has so many good things, sausages, meats, cheeses, sandwiches, pastries, cookies, cakes,  pasta, and meatballs,  just to name a few. If you're ever in the store you have to try Romanelli's bottled Marinara Sauce, it's absolutely delicious. It's the only bottled sauce you wont have to doctor up, its perfect right out of the jar.   Romanelli's offers a hot and cold lunch counter with daily specials like chicken parmesan, sausage & pepper sandwiches, Itaian beef sandwich and so much more. My favorite is the Italian Stallion, loaded with imported meats, cheeses, and Italian dressing, the perfect sandwich and it's big enough for two.   You can  'eat in' at small tables next to deli counter or get a great pinic lunch to go. The staff is wonderful at this family-owned restaurant, the prices are reasonable, and the food is delicious. If you're ever in the neighborhood you have to stop by you will not be disappointed.

F9QRg7pk2UmqHLP869BE2w.text: We ate at Romanelli's on a stop in Phoenix en route to San Diego. What an amazing place. The deli menu is massive and they have every cheese and meat you could want. The market has a wonderful selection of imported goods and fun Italian gifts and collectibles. I had the eggplant parmesan sandwich and it was the real deal. Friendly family staff. YUM! It's definitely worth a trip!

Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TiF5XSIUCXZIVxFxGNO8Aw.text: Best deli in Phoenix. Had the eggplant parm sandwich it was very good. Wanted to get some meats but I was on lunch at work, LOL.  Friendly service, the Italian sausage looked amazing and homemade. great place.

buCn1UVpG1XxLoDH3GVUVw.text: To call this place a deli understates things a lot. It does have an awesome deli, but they also have tons of imported Italian goods, delicious pastries ( try the Sfogliatella), and for those like me who want authentic food without the prep work, they have a great frozen section where you can get Manacotti, shells, cavatelli, and so much more. I'll definitely make this a regular stop.

TxWdJrlQZGTt1N1anEfDmw.text: Great Italian cookies and pastries, also cheeses and cold cuts.  Delicious catered meals at good prices.  Extensive Italian grocery items both bottled, canned frozen and dried inventory.  Very nice people.  I just wish they had choices of hard crusted Italian breads.  I love that at the Holidays they have great specialty goods.

dadKfUHcv8Ht-tdm7JgkJQ.text: I REALLY wanted to like this place. We just moved around the corner and were so excited to try it. I ordered two of the Italian Stallion sandwiches and brought them home. The bread was inedible. It was literally rock hard in some spots. This was unbelievably disappointing. The guy making them had to realize how stale the bread was, right???? I noticed he pulled it out of an open bag just sitting there but I didn't think it would be that bad. So upsetting, we won't return

xIUUsZmaD9-pnhmV9YBANg.text: Place is amazing, great food friendly people and it is awesome. I dig this place. I would recommend the sausage pasta and just about anything

mCPocZcgBZlhWRKj5wfx_g.text: Lived in Phx for 13 years and always talked about going to this deli! Well...I'm so sorry we waited the 13 years! Two words "da bomb!" We had the Italian sausage with peppers, provolone &  marinara and a ham, turkey &  provolone sub that were totally outstanding! Also bought Italian cookies that are amazing!! The grocery selections......tempting to say the least!! So cannot wait to get back there to try out more sub choices!!

Y3h8j_BL7gDVJE9L55x3ag.text: It's awesome that places like this still exist in the world! Great sandwiches, awesome selection of Italian groceries. I love places likes this

rMijdnEP_sMBk6Qn_kUM0Q.text: One of the best Italian delis around, not just in Phoenix, but ever! Fresh rolls with endless combinations of deli meats and cheeses. They have a sandwich menu, but you can pretty much get anything you want from their case of Boar's Head meats and cheese and hot food selections.   Some of my favorites are the Italian Stallion, meatball, and Robert's Special. But lately, Robert's Special has had my heart, perfect combo of roast beef and pastrami, swiss, mayo, tomato, and onions toasted to perfection. It's gotten to the point that when Robert sees me walk up to the counter he already knows I want his namesake sandwich. All the sandwiches are HUUGE and only $10 with chips and a drink.   Romanelli's is a family run place and in addition to an amazing deli, they're also a small Italian market with everything from homemade cannolis to frozen raviolis to ten different type of canned olives. You can also order hot food from the deli to go and/or cater food. All the staff are amazing and super friendly and you feel like you're apart of the fam (or maybe I just go too much?). And like any good catholic, they're closed on Sundays.

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Robert&#39;s special

4bjwTjz9p5brRfTXIKzYug.text: This Italian deli is AMAZING! The owners are so welcoming and they always make/sell the most delicious foods. I would recommend Romanlli's Italian Deli to EVERYONE!

gtN9eZ80C9X8eXTuVDnLtg.text: I used to like this place until I ordered an eggplant parm sandwich....never go back. The eggplant parm was thin dry and burnt and should have never been served.

CWpKWScxlsXJD9mGJdUGjQ.text: Only 3 stars cause they have done away with their lunch combosnow everything is a la carte, chasing $$, will lose customers so sad. Keep the combos, just raise the price if you must, we can all understand that. It will be a long time before we return.

h6nhndfauTOwkJ7fMJjGKQ.text: Someone told me that there was an Italian deli/bakery that had all the NY goodies I grew up on so we had to take the hour plus ride to try it out. They had rainbow cookies, butter cookies, heros, hot and cold food,  tons of Italian specialty items that you will not be able to find in The local supermarkets. We got a chicken cutlet hero, spiced ham and cheese hero, spaghetti and meatballs, rainbow cookies, butter cookies. Everything was great! Def will remember next we are going to be in that area again.
