z1loNMZ72oatzx065YGwmA.text: Neighborhood market and deli, family owned and operated, super friendly and outgoing.   Food: I got the lasagna lunch combo, that came with garlic bread. The sauce was good in taste, but was served cold. The bakery items are delicious, butter cookies are too die for.

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lasagna

ej-lfx_zxhWOaNYr1dUt9Q.text: Thought this was a great place, lots of Italian food to buy. We thought of getting a sandwich there but decided on Jason's Deli, but went back here to get dessert. Not a lot of pastries to choose from, but found a couple we really enjoyed. I also got fresh mozzarella and made chicken parm the next day, it was very good. Too far from our house to go often, but in the area would definitely stop and maybe try a sandwich, they did look good. We guess the bread was sold out as the case was empty, maybe the early birds got the bread and pastries, have to remember that when we return.

BSTYhzk6T6HEe_giRxFoNQ.text: Italian deli and groceries. I stumbled upon Romanelli's through my daughter's boyfriend. His family love Italian food and have lived in the Moon Valley area for a long time. We decided to try out their subs for dinner. Their Italian bread subs were much larger than I expected. They toast it beautifully before stuffing them with meats and cheeses. You have the option of wheat and white breads as well. I decided on Italian as per recommendation of the proprietors.  The meatball sub was my favorite. The meatballs were large and juicy, smothered with cheesy goodness on crunchy toasted bread.  The Italian Stallion is lovely if you like cold cuts. It came with a variety of rich Italian meats. I am afraid I cannot name them. I would love to taste them individually the next time, but I admit that I wolfed my portion down.  The chicken Parmigiana sub was okay. I admit that I am a sucker for the freshly battered and fried then smothered sandwich. This one was not. It was a cooked breast with tomato sauce and cheese cooked concoction.  The baked ziti was rich and cheesy as well. It almost looked like lasagna. It came with a nice piece of garlic bread.  Finally, the cannoli was crispy and filled with a light, creamy filling with a hint of cinnamon and vanilla. Delicious! It was a delightful meal that fed 5 people for $42.

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stallion
Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Parmesan sub
Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Garlic bread

f5AVoF5YfVWPPezONGHvbQ.text: Mmmm, just thinking about Romanelli's cheesecake makes my mouth water! I got there by accident, but now I think it was fate. I fell instantly in love with the atmosphere and the service was really great. Food is delish, the people are awesome, I can't wait to go there again.

9NWMI2sYGO0Xmk23pAGUvQ.text: Great subs! Come hungry portions are plenty.  Deli also has a good variety of meats. Italian Stallion is great!

8t4jb1SO7wfLQQr8zF_DGg.text: This place is a gem. Any Italian in phoenix or Arizona for that matter would be crazy not to visit romanellis. Eat in and take home everything. From fresh made cannoli to frozen gnocchi and everything in between its an amazing family owned and operated business.  From the time you walk in your are in their home. Thank you for a great place that brings back the Italian village feel in the desert.

LxUow9XmI2RuEqsZiQlKJA.text: First, the service was outstanding! Very friendly people. They made you feel like you were part of the family. Had some sub sandwiches - they were okay. Not bad but nothing special. I thought the prices for their grocery items were on the high side. I'm new to Phoenix so perhaps this is because Italian items are harder to come by than on the East coast? Just a guess. We were really disappointed in the cookies. They looked great! We picked out just under a dozen different varieties and they all tasted the same: stale. I don't know if they were baked too long ago or if had soaked up the smells of various sandwich meats, but they all tasted like they had been in a fridge with other foods for quite a while. They were expensive, too. The last disappointment was that we realized that they had charged us a service fee (without telling us) for using our credit card. And since we bought the cookies separately (after our meal) we got charged this fee twice.

A7MMpdn7GdQgQD1-iuNzNA.text: Old school deli that has amazing food.  Chicken parm and lasagna are my favorites.  You cannot go wrong with either or both.  The tiramisu and cannoli's are perfect.  Great spot or Italian sausage to make at home too.

R2Xqij9lgeU8EdyLGDTYtQ.text: 10-inches of hard crust Italian bread stuffed with ham, capicolla, salami, mortadella (hold the pepperoni), provolone, hot peppers, lettuce, tomato, onion and Italian dressing. Heaven. Great deal at only $7.95! Waaay to much sandwich for one person for lunch.   They have a lovely pastry case filled with Italian cookies, cannoli shells (and cannoli, but I prefer to make my own filling - viva Sambuca and chocolate chips!) and sfogliatelle.   Aisles and aisles of canned, jarred, boxed and bagged Italian pantry essentials (and they're not covered in dust like some other places).   Keep an eye on the prices. Some are fair - Polly-O brand is hard to come by in the Valley but others are practical extortion! ($20 for Illy espresso!!?)

AXyIfV1PpHreFPBQkEj-wQ.text: I love this place! And the staff is extremely friendly. The sandwiches are huge and delicious! But the amazing part of this place is the giant case of Italian butter cookies when you walk in. Cookie Heaven!!!!!!

pVv1fGgGMXv4jkLDJBU6dA.text: I feel so lucky to have had good service and Awesome sandwiches from this place!!!!  Have you have not been here I highly recommend it!!! 5 stars is not enough 10 PS it is Closed on Sunday

u_wF2ziwQsAaJGAzth8L5w.text: The subs are huge!  2 adults can split them.  Roast beef sub with everything and Italian sub loaded were particularly good.  Add on a pound of butter cookies, pasta salad and poolside lunch was complete.  Staff behind the deli counter were super nice and efficient!

7t9uaUIOZpr1rUdM2Cl-5g.text: Very NY style Italian deli. They have great sandwiches and homemade cookies.

n4lQybcKubTWko7TUmXpSA.text: If you don't eat at Romanellis YOU ARE CRAZY.  They put out a 8-10" Sub that puts SUBWAY and other places TO SHAME with the amount and quality of ingredients they put in it.   OMG is their stuff good.  They've got a hot Italian lunch buffet (lasagna, fettucini, parmeasana, ... as well as the best grinders in town.  Their HOME MADE potato and macaroni salads are EXQUISITE.  If you are reading this, stop now!  Get in the car and get over to Romanellis!  OMG is it good.  EVERYONE I have ever TAKEN there is BLOWN AWAY by their sammies.  WTF are you waiting for, or eating at a fast food place?  Their prices might be $1 more than eating fast food but its FANTASTIC!

oSk8ZnIZstWvih6SLuru3w.text: Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes! I'm a NYC Italian and I was really missing real authentic Italian food. I really thought I could not find any authentic Italian anything anywhere in Arizona and I was really disappointed. Then I heard about this lovely place. They make REAL meatballs and REAL sauce. Buy the jarred sauce and buy the meatballs. You won't be disappointed.  The sauce tastes like my grandma's sauce, and that's saying a lot. The cannolis are also excellent. They use the REAL ricotta cheese that you can only find back east - Polly-O brand Ricotta Cheese. I asked the owner about it and she said they have the cheese special-ordered and shipped out so they can make the cannolis right. And I'm SO glad they do! This store has a lot of specialty Italian items that you can't find anywhere else, except maybe in Italy.   You can also order from the deli area and they have a great selection of hot and cold items and some table and chairs where you can get a quick bite. The sandwiches are as close to NY style as I could find.

0J1Y5C-5blgRdE4OD-CC2g.text: So after hearing about this deli I had to go. All I can say is. It was like good sex I wanted to have a cigarette after but then I remembered I don't smoke outstanding place. The locations not the best but sometimes that's where the greatest places are hidden give it a try I'm sure you'll agree.

SojeCQy143C5_KNdzkh7SQ.text: Great deli!  Everything is delicious.  We had driven by this place for years; can't believe we never stopped in until now.  We will definitely be back.

v8QetbBER7acIqM-yacyYw.text: Oh my, Yelp worked again, my wife And I stopped in and first saw the wonderful looking canoli's and cookies at the front counter so we decided to split a 10" sub George's special sub actually, so we could get a dessert.  The sub had so much meat and I'm talking best quality tasty meat that we didn't need any dessert, but we did manage to force down a piece of tiramisu mmmmmmm!!!!! Great choice---- I'll be back!!

53joBHcnYXSQfigQzUBDIw.text: Best cannoli around. But the attitude of the staff is glaringly bad - unless you're Italian.  It's family operated, this staff is family. I asked  once why they weren't open past 6pm, for dinner. I was told because the neighborhood is bad. The neighborhood is bad and it reflects in their attitude toward their customers. The past half a dozen times I've been there, I was treated pleasantly once.  My daughter enjoys the chicken parm & my dad occasionally asks for the cannoli or I would not shop here. They're on my way home from work, otherwise I drive out of my way to get to them. Not worth it to me. My daughter and my dad don't have to deal with these rude, rude people. When you walk in the door, in addition to a buzzer, they have a mechanical voice that says "front door". I walk in and say a cheery good morning. They grunt to themselves and go back to their work. The attitude just gets worse as you're shopping and checking out.

C7NI1SUpf9ry7QJkmVGa3A.text: Sorry guys,  I went here after reading reviews and word of mouth.  Growing up in NYC and taking many a date to Little Italy and China Town.  I went in this morning looking to get some pastries and cookies for my morning JOE.  Well bought Napoleon, Cannoli's , Biscotti, and Sesame cookies.   The Napoleon must have been in the case for about a week (custard was all skinned over and like strings), Cannoli was horrible filling not very sweet and not very creamy, the shell was crispy, biscotti had no flavor and was like cardboard.  Sesame cookies were good, like old NY.   Not sure if I will ever go back. Still have bad after taste of stale Napoleon and Cannoli.  :O(

-ocTJ79amvFTFOUghF1U1Q.text: Delicious meatball sub!! They fill the bread till its overflowing!! Love it here plus all the Italian groceries are a huge plus!?!

Lu9CEEOR9okX4IQLREKWVg.text: Best pastrami sandwich in town by far!! Also lots of groceries to take home with you. Great people great place!

36NTHqa5PbxDrECybqXFIg.text: I read all the reviews and made my decision to go to Romanelli's off of them....bad idea.   I got the 'itallion stallion' and added turkey, which meant my sub was around $9.00 plus. There was a good amount of meat on the sandwich, but I asked for everything except onions, but somehow didnt get any oil and vinegar so my sandwich was super dry,   The wheat bread was not very good, and too thick.   Overall, I was not impressed and regret going. I will stick to duck and decanter and jersey mike's subs from now on.

vpgprkatfagEJdJClyQsuA.text: When I was pregnant, I came here frequently for their meatball subs. I love their Italian cookies. The grocery section and deli have everything you need to make a fabulous Italian dinner for the family.

MXAbFcVq29IudKpSy5oRSA.text: My husband and son LOVED their sandwich, and that's saying a lot!!! I for one, couldn't stop licking the wrapper that the Lemoncello Marscopone cheesecake was sitting on. Hands down one of the best desserts I've ever had! Nice sized italian grocery store, fabulous meat and cheese selection, and the staff was so friendly. I'll be picking up that cake for Thanksgiving.

qcIhWLp9uVpETrSm5mAGvA.text: As far as Italian deli's go, this place is the real deal.  It's a fantastic and authentic deli and market.  The only problem is that it's in a horrible neighborhood with scummy and questionable characters...both outside, as well as patrons inside.  If you can deal with the substandard humans, then go for it.  You won't be disappointed with the authenticity and quality.

1V_7YccdV1rTZLubmMW9VA.text: I drive past this place everyday and have never gone before today, i went for lunch and oh my goodness! Best sandwich i think i have ever had! Had the newyorker sandwich which is a double stuffed pastrami sandwich and the the robert special which was pastrami,provolone cheese,  roast beef, mayo and other things i forgot, it was $10.99 for the newyorker but they are so big i only ate half! (so half for lunch tomorrow and when you think subway sells a shit sandwich for around $8 it doesnt even compare). De falcos is a similar concept in scottsdale which is good but this place is way better. They have a full market of imported italian products and a pastry stand too selling fresh italian pastries cookies and bread. I had a homemade cannolis and italian and it was delicious not too sweet. There was a super cute Italian man handing out samples of his hand made italian sausage which they also sell there. 100% will not be just driving past anymore!

GVrAvRDpAG4QeVBCZNjLTw.text: Loved this place the first time we went several weeks ago and decided to go back yesterday for more. I very much enjoyed the grilled sub special on wheat. My friend opted for the chicken parm sub on Italian bread and after eating more than half I noticed the bread was moldy on the final 2" of the sub as he was about to take another bite. An anomaly I am sure. Needless to say we were shocked. We had ordered out and didn't have time to return the sub, unfortunately, but I think it is safe to say we won't be returning.

UfPnYLh4Efc52wz6plqYtw.text: How have I lived 3 miles from this place for 8 years and had never been in until a few weeks ago!?!?!  Man, I was doing it all wrong. Home made sausage, good Italian pasta, San Marzano tomatoes, everything you need to make a great meal all in one shop, with a side of personality!  I haven't tried the sandwiches yet, but looking at the big old hock of prosciutto de parma in their cooler, I'll be back for those next!

Cv7n5Ickq8nSloZqpwoP-Q.text: Any sandwich that I have had is fresh. I have been coming here for over 9 years. Besides food they are a small mom and pop grocery store, that carries imported items from Italy and some Greek food too. Best Italian place in phx

1DBPai4aoI4b7q2eeBrAhg.text: We stopped by here to get a small bite for a friend. What a treasure we happened to find! I wish we would've had more time and hunger to try more than just cannoli. The Cannoli was good!  Be prepared for the quintessential group of older guys leering at you and making appreciative noises - Seriously felt like we popped out of a movie set for Goodfellas.

kGdrCIX5QwgD2u2Z7bbPOg.text: This place is addictive,The best Romano an fresh parmesan ever,gotta try the pachetto sub.

MPhl5ddHGA5wdxejz66k_g.text: This place is authentic and food is great! Definitely a great place for sandwiches and desserts.

RLDnwJrAa6r5x3__np7GMQ.text: Moving to the area and saw this place from the road and immediately pulled in. They love Italy and sell some ridiculous souvenirs and kitschy stuff displaying that pride with a sense of humor. Also they have some of the best selection of Italians groceries I've seen in the valley. We got subs and a cannoli and were not let down at all. This place has the small town corner store feel with the great variety and high quality products that you expect to find in big box stores. If the food and ambiance doesn't get you, the super friendly staff will. These guys know their stuff, can hold a conversation and seem to really enjoy their jobs and helping customers. Definitely worth checking out!

764GJA8WOaOOH5jLkfSx6g.text: As soon as I walked in, I felt like I was back home in a New York Italian deli. It smelt incredible. There was a HUGE variety of Italian delicacies. I ended up getting a sub( the godfather), with all the fixings. It was perfect! We also purchased stuffed chicken ( stuffed with cheeses, tomatoes, peppers and prosciutto ). I felt like I was eating my grandmas stuffed chicken! DELICIOUS!   I was thrilled to find Ferrara torrone ( Italian almond & honey nougat candy) that my Grandma used to buy all the time when I was little.  Over all the food was delicious, however the prices were a bit much. I did purchase an over price keychain ( couldn't be worth more that $1, I paid 9.99), as well as a lanyard. Our total came to  a little under $50!   I will be returning before I move back east!

9nVbAG8yi-S66VbPlsxiuQ.text: Get George's Special with giardiniera, and grab a Bundeburg Ginger Beer.  I know this review was terse, but if you haven't been here before, this is all the information you need.

TSJdPp8ts3uoNAurNee0aA.text: Best Italian Deli in AZ! Every year, for as long as I can remember, around the holidays we make a stop to stock up on homemade bread, pasta, and imported Italian meats and cheeses. We live nearly 30 miles away and it is more than worth the trip. Sometimes we pick up a sub or 2 and they are without a doubt the best sandwiches around. They are an institution in the state of Arizona and I look forward to going there every year and bringing future generations to continue the family tradition!

PnykRA8ELHul-gkRMOkEPA.text: THANK GOD there is a HIGH quality Italian deli nearby the house...Turns out that this deli is THE go to Italian deli in Phoenix, lucky me...Looking for hard to find Italian items, they are here, looking for amazing Tiramisu or Cannolis, they are here, looking for whole wheat Gnocchi, here....They have a great website that offers what product lines they carry, BIG help....and they have an awesome deli counter with WONDERFUL sandwiches and sides....LOVE THIS PLACE!

WEdcyHPqoV6jeetK-uomIg.text: There was nothing about this place I didn't like. I just ate the hot NY pastrami with the spicy mustard and provolone cheese and it was amazing! 4psgxL0SlQ5bAu3__dZR1w.text: I recently moved in the area and was looking for a good sub shop. This place is amazing! True authentic Italian deli. Since it was my first time there, I had asked the nice lady if she had any recommendations. I had one of specials with hot peppers and it was way better than any sub shop I have been to. I will always try to support the mom and pop shop, but with subs like these, there is no surprise they have been for over 30 years. This place will hit the spot!

7W9fvCP8TAvlb2375RKOXA.text: Had their italian sub. Excellent. Great quality meats and bread. Staff was very helpful at the deli. Will definitely recommend this place and come back when I come back to Phoenix.

Lots of Italian meats and cheeses, salads, olives, pasta salad's and the deli sandwiches are awesome and made with fresh ingredients. FtewHl6SWLqII_pTzL4dIA.text: I have come to this place on and off for a number of years. Excellent old school Italian Deli and Market. They use Boar's Head meat and make plenty of their own stuff from scratch. The owners are working and are very friendly and helpful and there to give you suggestions because they do have a large menu to choose from. You really can't go wrong with anything you picked from this place. Lots of Deli and Market goods from Italy as well as other places in Europe that you can't find in most stores. If you have not been here before and you're in the area I highly recommend coming out and getting a sandwich or some Goods. You will not be disappointed.

i8oOi8lbfPMJdRCKupQKGw.text: Romanelli's Italian Deli has consistently been a traditional stop for my family over the years. The staff here is incredible and extremely friendly. They have a wide selection of traditional Italian goods that are hard to find anywhere else. My families favorite item to purchase here is their homemade spicy/sweet italian sausage. These sausages are to die for and go amazing in any pasta. Their pastry counter also has some great cannolis for sale along with other desserts. Overall Romanelli's is an amazing place that houses authentic Italian products and a top notch staff that is always friendly.

All tastes exactly the same & it's like going home again. Romanelli's is truly a hidden gem in the Phoenix area & I love what they bring to Arizona.

My only complaint is that I couldn't take the shop with me to San Antonio (which could use it).

xOzrb7drCVwYsrUVIdrYpg.text: Today was the second time I have been to Romanelli's. I ordered the Roberts deli special sandwich and let me tell you I was not disappointed. If you are into anti pasta you must try it as well. The ambiance of this place is of an Italian deli with a neighborhood look of an Italian grocer and meat market. When you first walk in you have to stop by their shirt display and second the cookies that you can purchase by the pound. The people there make you feel like you have been here many times and make you feed right at home. On the way out you must try the baked goods and especially their canoli's or whatever your eyes direct you to. Look around the store and listen to the background music. The music takes you back in time. You will feel like you're somewhere else besides in Phoenix. This is a place that you will come back to even if you don't live nearby.

Q581DEdmqcnBGDoU1sLHqw.text: OH MY GOODNESS - I think I may just be Romanelli's new biggest fan! It is a good thing that it is about 40 minutes from my house, otherwise I would most likely be there a few times a week! My husband and I were running an errand on the west side of town and were craving sandwiches. I quickly pulled out my Yelp app and 2 options came up within a few block radius - 1) Blimpie and 2) Romanelli's - ummmmmm, local love all day baby! Naturally, we went with Romanelli's and are SO glad that we did.   I ordered their Italian sandwich on white bread with all of the fixins and it was so dang good! The bread was soft and perfect and you could tell the meats were HIGH quality! Romanelli's is also an Italian grocer so we picked up some delicious pickled goods and freshly baked Italian pastries that were to die for. We'll absolutely be back when in the area and will most likely find ourselves making the 40 minute drive just to get it! Do yourself a favor and stop in for a delicious meal at this lovely family-owned and operated establishment.

Lvh-8BzTw2wwor9XUEebBw.text: This must be my lucky month. I'm discovering more and more places that serve foods that remind me of my favorite stomping grounds in NYC. I've been to Romanelli's earlier this year, on March 19 - the feast of St. Joseph, to see if they sold those wonderful special filled zeppoles named after the saint and sold in Italian bakeries and food stores on his feast day. They did, and the pastries were delicious. I also browsed the packaged and canned goods areas and found lots of high quality Italian foods not normally found in supermarkets and regular food stores.   But it was today after reading the reviews here that I decided to try the deli. I ordered the Italian Stallion sub and it was really, really good! The meats were very high quality, fresh and ample, and there was just enough lettuce, tomatoes, red onion, and dressing to enhance the flavors without competing with the deli meats. It's so good to know that there is a great deli place not far from where I live, and where I can treat myself to or bring visiting friends for a great New York style deli experience.

PjF_iO7P9kNeRZBIBd7euA.text: I can't count the number of people I have told about Romanelli's, and they end up coming regularly from all parts of the Valley.  I live relatively close, and have been going to for over 30 years, since I moved from NYC.  Genuine NY-style Italian deli/suprette,  Friendly, enthusiastic employees provide great service, and their selection of cold cuts, cheeses, Italian groceries, breads, cookies and cakes can't be beat. From specialty subs like the "Italian Stallion" or "Robert's Special", hot meatball or chicken parm sandwiches, to one of the best hot pastrami sandwiches in Phoenix, this is the place to take your appetite!

o82tYdRZogVTgmKnspfQwQ.text: The sandwich was good. The cookies lacked flavor. I picked a lemon cookie and could not taste any lemon at all. I went for the sandwich so I give four stars and stay away from the cookies next time.

BL82caxaZ2NXQoqMEF5InQ.text: Gruff italian deli/bakery/market/bodega extraordinaire. Had heard of it's reputation via Yelp and swung in when I passed it on Dunlap. To be honest, I just went for the cannoli. Staff suggested the baked ziti or the chicken parmesan, but they were out of both (granted, it was ten minutes til close).   Deli looked well stocked and downright delicious, but my eyes were on the prize... they filled 6 cannoli as I wandered the aisles, checking out their pasta selection (actually not too impressive). I asked for a bag of ice to keep them cool as I live an hour away and the kid brought a ten-pound bag of ice, the kind you buy for your beer cooler.   The manager said, "Did you charge her for that?" Well, I didn't actually need a BAG of ICE, I wanted the cannoli to keep cool. Offered up my credit card as a peace offering and he shook his head, kinda disgusted and shooed me out with a "just take it and go." I felt guilty, but hey, if you don't get my drift and charge me $2.00 for a bag of beverage ice then expect cash... I brought in $2 in change that I scrounged for in my car and he seemed surprised.  Cannoli were good, authentic, but the shell was a little thick for my taste. If I'm in the neighborhood, I'll stop by again, perhaps hit up the deli. Word of advice: spell out what you want and maybe you'll get it, maybe you won't. And maybe you'll have to pay extra :)

-zYk_DIPffE1Cma-NwBMXg.text: This was dad favorite west side Italian deli.. He got his bread here and sub rolls but go early they sell out.. my niece loved there subs.. Good stuff Family owned...

DwDiJOc0bOI1RPH18YehqA.text: So lucky I live near by! We love everything from here. Lasagna, stuffed shells, sammiches, and the best cannoli and baklava.

pz8RgF1Fjc6F9Sj-MvXBgA.text: Best subs in Phoenix! The owner was super nice and welcoming. The staff was always ready to help. The pastries are the perfect end to a meal!  Definitely coming back!

vmkby8sEB6qwoEg8ds06wQ.text: Went here for lunch again yesterday and it was as good or even better than the first time. I had the Georges Special and some potato salad and both were outstanding. My mouth is watering now just thinking about  it.  I sure wish this place wasn't 37 miles away as I'd go back today for lunch if it were closer.

f-bswvj_Eq7zBU3QxzkgyQ.text: Originally I never even heard of this place. It was like a hidden gem. My Italian coworker told me about it when I told him I had trouble finding a place that can make a good cannoli. (I can make them myself but I don't want to).   We got our sandwiches to go. The sandwiches were super good. They had great quality ingredients. I would definitely return again. The only thing I didn't like about this place is the location. It seems kinda scary if I were to go alone at night. However, they close at 6pm. But inside, it's very cute. They have a bunch of stuff for sale like little signs, a great olive oil selection, a bunch of baked goods, and other imported awesomeness. If I had more money I probably would have spent like $100 on a few olive oils in there.   The workers were efficient and very nice. It was a very pleasant experience.   But back to the sandwiches: the bread was fresh and had great flavor. I'm super picky on bread. I think if a place has terrible bread, everything else can only be mediocre at best. It had a great texture, wasn't overly dense or too chewy. We wanted to try a few different sandwiches. We had the 19, which is Robert's special (our new favorite)-$7.99. It had roast beef, pastrami, provolone, tomato, mayo & onion. It was everything you want a hot sandwich to taste like that didn't have anything fried on it. I was glad they didn't put too much mayo on it. I'm generally not a fan of mayo. But all the flavors worked well together. I'd be back just based on that sandwich alone. We also tried 15, their super sub with ham, capicolla, pepperoni & I don't remember what kind of cheese-$7.99. It was good though. That one wasn't anything spectacular, but we were definitely not disappointed. We got 7, the "Italian stallion" house sub.-$6.99. It had ham, capicolla, genoa salami, pepperoni & provolone. I liked this one a lot too. It had a great combination of flavors. I would recommend this one as well. The last sandwich we brought home was 18, George's special-$7.99. It had ham, capicolla, salami, mortadella (a pink Italian sausage made of finely ground pork, & smooth textured) , pepperoni, provolone and hot peppers. They asked if we wanted mild or hot peppers. We of course, wanted hot peppers. I feel like I'm repeating myself, but it also was pretty awesome. Everything worked well together in the sandwich. I loved the slight crunch from the hot peppers as well as that extra "zing" it adds.   And the whole reason that we went there, the cannoli-$2.99. I only bought one and I wish I bought more. I'm kind of glad I didn't though because I probably could have eaten a bunch. It had a good texture for the cannoli shell. It wasn't soggy or rock hard. The filling was great. It wasn't overly sweet. It didn't have raisins, so I was really glad about that. It probably could have used a little bit more mascarpone in the filling, but it was still extremely delicious and a really great treat. I will buy more of these when I'm back too. I can't wait to try the other yummy looking treats as well.

OOXgxgizWIpl7vCHh6DkgA.text: I pulled into the parking lot of the ghetto looking mini mall that Romanelli's is tucked into and parked right in front.   In the last few minutes of enjoying the A/C in my car, I looked around at the writing all over the windows of Romanelli's and saw the entrance to the right and exit to the left... I was instantly taken back to my summer backpacking in Italy.  If you have ever visited Italy, and you never had to visit the supermercato while you were there, then you have no idea what I'm talking about, but for those of you that have been broke and backpacking, you know what I mean when I say this place has the same set up as an authentic Italian market-- a designated entrance, and very far away, usually after walking through the entire store, a designated exit.  And don't you dare go in through the exit... I don't know why, but it is heavily frowned upon.  Anyway, the only reason I came here was because I had a cannoli craving.  I picked up a Rockstar and two cannoli (one for me, one for my grandma), for about $10- kinda pricey, but it was worth it.  Best. Cannoli. In Phoenix.  If you had to make me choose, I'd go the Godfather route... take the cannoli, leave the gun..

Yfm2nFkXefh6EW2E7mf6RA.text: What an excellent deli! I had the Roberts special a few times now and it's delicious along with the macaroni salad. Thanks Robert for the delicious sandwich!

P8pO-MvX_i28R55oqEaCuw.text: I have been coming here off and on for years and usually get treated okay,  but today it was different. I go in after having a stressful day at work all morning and day to get there by 3:15pm to purchase and eat my first meal of the day to have this what I feel was a ignorant,  prejudice, hateful old  man with glasses on was making my sandwich and he kept abruptly, rudely dismissing me and what I was saying I wanted on my sandwich and I found that to be embarrassing and rude. The people standing around me were uncomfortable with the whole approach as well,  so I calmly stood there thinking to myself, I deserve better treatment than what I am receiving and I feel that I am not being treated as the loyal valued customer as I should be. So then another worker that usually is there most of the time when I have ordered my food comes walking up and so I was assured everything was going to be okay by this point after my salutation to him and he dismissed and ignored me as well in front of all the customers that were standing around me and started taking their orders as he antagonized me in the process in how his coworker was mistreating me. I took it as if he thought it was funny to play with my fuckin food.  Well now you know Romanellis that I do do not play when it comes to fair, good, and acceptable treatment to a customer that has done nothing but up sale your company with compliments and how good your food is.  The arrogance that I have been receiving lately when coming in there has made me feel uncomfortable and now my blood pressure is high because my food was not satisfied and this is why I walked out on you after seeing the condescending prick was getting negative attitudes with me when in fact now I will and now have an attitude with Romanellis and the entire environment and staff. I am already spreading the word by mouth how you guys treated me today and will never come in there again and I have let three people know already and they said they will not go in there anymore.  Learn how to treat people especially the loyal customers that has done nothing but show you loyalty and love.  I can't stand this fuckin place now.  That was and is the last button of mine to push. I will not allow anyone or an arrogant business, person, or group ever mistreat and make me feel unworthy again. No more Romanellis for me, oh I forget thats what they wanted in the first place in mistreating me. So no loss right??  What a fuckin joke.

ZKZ6iLJCuWFMi4_C79ZF9g.text: Such a wonderful family atmosphere! Sandwiches and desserts were great but the hospitality alone was worth the visit!

VjKlEz32BXkOrR8u0wM8MQ.text: I have been shopping here every few months for the last five years. Every now and then, my family gets the craving for authentic Italian subs, and Romanelli's is always the first place that comes to mind. You can get far more than just subs, however. You can purchase deli meat and hot meals (pasta, chicken parmesan, eggplant Parmesan...) at the back counter, and towards the front there are sweets galore. We're talking New York cheesecake, cannolis, macaroons, and much more.   As for the rest of the place? It's built like a small grocery store but filled with imported Italian foods. Everything from pizza dough, pasta (frozen or dry), sauce, condiments...It's all here and it's all authentic.   My dad has made friends with a few of the workers, but especially Robert the owner. He is extremely helpful and goes above and beyond. It's not uncommon that we get a TON of food from Romanelli's to satiate a party we are having at the house, and each time the order has been 100% perfect. Our guests consistently comment on how good the food is!

J7R9Sur5tEyvODLoRJxCqA.text: I love trying italian delis and I felt like this one fell short. I'm not sure if it was just an off day for them or what but I had very weird off putting vibe from them. I went out of my way to try them on a Friday for the very first time. Seats were about 3/4 full with one giant party. Not a single worker or customer looked like they were in a good mood. Nobody laughed or was smiling the whole 30 mins or so I was there. It was odd. The mood was so depressing I actually felt quite uncomfortable eating there. The workers were not particularly friendly and none greeted me either. I have visited Andreolis Italian grocers and cheese n stuff which were my favorite Italian grocers. Andreolis has great Italian meals with homemade pasta and their bread is all made in house and so good. And the workers there all love to chat and are super friendly and authentically Italian. Most Italian spots I've hit love having convos with their guests and are generally in an upbeat mood. Lots of owners have personally approached me to introduce themselves. This was not the case at romanellis. Just a complete night and day difference from the workers at romanellis. Cheese n stuff has some of the best Italian sandwhiches in phoenix even tho it's a hole in the wall. Their hot sandwiches are not super sloppy and wet and watery but are full of flavor and not too salty. I just expected more out of romanellis after experiencing some other Italian Delis that have made me proud. I feel like I deserve better at romanellis. I hope workers were just tired that day.   The food was sloppy and too salty. I ordered a hot beef sub which looked great upon order. But I took one bite and juice just splattered everywhere. The bread was super toasted but upon the burst of juice immediately became a soggy mess. The bread fell apart on both sides. I had to pick up soggy bread with my fingers and pinch together meat to eat with it. I wanted to take a picture but both my hands were so greasy. I hope this was just an off day. The sandwich did have good flavor and I would eat it again but it was just too wet to be eaten as a sandwhich. I don't know if the guy forgot to drain the beef that day or what. I hear good things about this place tho so I will give them another shot. Maybe I will try a dry cold cut next time as many pix that said positive reviews were of their cold sandwhiches. I would not get the hot Italian beef sandwhich again.

qQf169AeVw6XunWzMH36tQ.text: This is a must stop anytime we are in Phoenix.   This family owned Italian shop has been around since 1975 and it shows gracefully. With Italian imports and an array of fresh, homemade goods, many people call this deli a little slice of home. It smells incredible and their sandwiches look like they are to die for. They have fresh sausages, hot and cold dishes, lots of grocery items, and so much more. They also have not one, but two large cases filled with all of the homemade desserts you could want, and yes of course, freshly made cannolis.  Everyone here is so friendly and close knit. Something else I love is seeing the many other regulars that just can't stay away. This little gem is a must try!

miqpGHvpsqJMxKEKVdSgFQ.text: As you walk into this old school deli, you are immediately transported back to the past. The smell of various breads and meats invite you in and the staff is very welcoming. I highly recommend ordering the NY pastrami or Chicago beef sandwiches.

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicago beef with gardiniera and au jus
Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. New York pastrami with mustard and cole slaw on rye bread

Z0eBa_KJc-R7q-TN7PpCow.text: I made my annual pilgrimage :-) to pick up 2 Eclairs, and a Chocolate Canolli for my birthday dessert tonight (plus, an Eclair for tomorrow).  Sevice (at the bakery counter, and checkout) was great, and if the treats taste as good as always, 5 stars for sure.  However, common sense for packaging the goodies gets 2 Stars. :-? As you can see from the picture, the guy put 1 Eclair on its side (luckily, the scrumptiouselious chocolate topping didn't peel off, too badly). But, the Chocolate Canolli lost a bit of filling because it was put in sideways, and scrapped the inside of the box. Sheesh.  Later tonight, I'll edit the review, after I eat the Canolli and an Eclair.  EDIT: Well, after the most awesome and fantastic dinner, I was only able to enjoy the Canolli, and half an Eclair (that leaves 1.5 Eclairs for tomorrow). But, they were as good as ever.  The only way the Chocolate Canolli could be made better, is to add Chocolate Chips to the filling (hint-hint, guys).  For the Eclair, I don't see how it can be improved. There have been a couple of incidents where the filling was missing from the middle 3rd of the Eclair was missing. But, that didn't happen today.  Had the goodies been packaged better, I would have given 'em 5 Stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. How the Eclairs and Chocolate Canolli were packed
Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Part of the Bakery display

2foOssHClEQ5yoreyHpahA.text: I'd never been to this amazingly authentic Italian experience before! I've driven by it quite a bit - you can't miss it. But inside, it's both an Italian market and an eaterie along with tables you can sit at and enjoy in there. They have sandwiches and pizza and fresh meats and cheeses... a large majority (if not all) Italian! But as I mentioned, it's a small grocer as well. Lots of Italian regalia you can get too... t-shirts, souvies... I didn't see italian soccer jerseys but i didn't ask.  They also have Italian flags and even delicious Italian desserts! We wound up having an Italian lemon cookie and some sandwich... both were finger licking good!   My hot sandwich was a special and it had pastrami, cheese, onions, tomatoes and onions. Of course you can compile it and make it your own. It was sooooo good! Really delicious indeed.   Tried to speak Italian to the cashier but she didn't know it, although she did try and said "gratzie" as we left, and helped us snap a photo of me and my friends.  And my sanswix

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pastrami sandwich (what was left of it)
Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Us, as we checked out before leaving
Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Italian lemon and ...

ysPd-9dSPmMzDMNRii1mBg.text: Just walked in and was in AWE. Ordered the Italian stallion sub and my boyfriend got the pepperoni and cheese sub both tasted so good !!

Z07siT1QszEG8mjrq4iUBg.text: Romanelli's Italian Deli is a small piece of Italy  heaven right here in the valley. I was very excited to stumble upon Romanelli's one afternoon while out. I love Italy and all things Italian, so I had to pop in and to my delight , everything in Romanelli's is just as it should be in an authentic old school Italian deli / market .. from scratch and from the old country. The family runs an operates Romanelli's and is very helpful in answering any questions or making any selections. They have lots of home made Italian pastries ; cakes ; cannoli! ; Italian specialities to go home like gnocchis ; lasagna ; chicken parmesan , to name a few. There are deli sandwiches made to order with Boar's Head meats .. on fresh bread and tons of olives and Italian salads too. The market part is great for Italian speciality items not easily found outside of Italy. Friendly service and a great place to get your Italian taste buds flowing. I am sold !

gjyv4oRpZWCkVw2d_elcww.text: We made a random lunch stop here via Yelp recommendation! This is a family run business and it looks like they are very passionate about their stuff! We ordered sandwiches to go (their famous Italian Sub) and that seems to be a popular menu item, three other people in line ordered the same sandwich. It was large and very good! I noticed they have Italian beef and pizza options also, will have to come back and try more goodies! They have a good selection of desserts and hot items as well that you can grab to go. Good seating area, if you want to stay in and eat there. The owner was very nice and invited us to come back.

BGDP5xiK67UR3yJKiNdw1g.text: Amazing meatballs and the bread. W. T. u know..... AND THEN....  Ok I need to focus.   I am torn to call this da best cause I frequent Delfalcos in Scottsdale BUT it I 1a for sure. The meatball is tender and melty with the good cheese on to then a nice spiceon too. But the bread is the star. I have never been so excited to eat bread, who would be , but I could eat this plain. Perfect toast that held the Sammie together despite the sw-auce all over the place. I am typing with one hand cause I can't put the Sammie down.  The pasta salad was fresh and tasty. They didn't put tomatos in it as much as WHOLE cherry tomatoes in it ! It was a salad with asparagus as well so I tried cuase I've never even heard about this style of salad. This thing is full of stuff and nothing is overpowering at all.   THEN THIS HAPPENED.... I could only assume the owner walks around with wax paper in his hand with his homemade sausage. Totally flavorful with a legit spice at the end. Wow. Dude jus walk-in around blowing peoples minds with his sausage(that's funny on a lot of levels)   THE ONLY FAULT I CAN FIND.... I don't live close. I would be diabetic if I did. I'm coming back and will report more cause ima try EVERYTHING.  Did I mention they sell homemade cookies by the lbs? AMAZING AND AND AND.... a full Italian grocery  Update: it's less than two days later and I'm already back. Had the sausage and peppers with sauce and cheese. BETTA THAN DA MEATBALL!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The sausage and peppers
Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Sm1czdbystRaUi6ebajjWg.text: The best Italian sandwich I've had in the valley, bar none. And at a very fair price.   I came with my wife for lunch, and we crushed our sandwiches, San Pellegrino's, and then walked around. I saw that they had guanciale - hard to find usually at most stores - and I got some. The gentleman packed it up, priced it, gave me a few more slices on top of that, "That's for the baby boy ... " He had seen my wife was pregnant. What a sweetheart.   Hours later, I realized I had dropped my wallet. Checked everywhere. Finally, called Romanelli's. They had found it outside. One of the staff met me in Central Phoenix to deliver it to me.   This is a class act, with staff members that are princes amongst men.

EoeAfMSUMC5_FERnF4BmWQ.text: Really great deli sandwiches! (That's all I have tried) The people behind the counter are really nice and the ingredients are fresh and really delicious. I definitely suggest trying the Italian stallion, it's great but my very favorite so far has been the mortadella and cheese. Their mortadella is so delicious. It's definitely become one of my go to lunch spots.

LOelInc4EKw1tizTnRud8w.text: I love these sandwiches. I come here once a week. Never again. As I am walking into the deli I walk by a couple of African Americans. They are talking to each other. We nod at each other. I walk into the store and I am stopped by the delis owner. He asks me "did those guys ask for money?" I say no, they were talking to each other. I ask why do you ask. He replies, "This our property and we don't allow that." I ask him if he is profiling. He ignores me. I leave. Straight up racist. To the owner you should be ashamed.

qAjYSB9MNnF0ryZycx-HFw.text: I came here because a friend from Chicago said I had to try an Italian Beef Sandwich which is comprised of seasoned beef on a long Italian-style roll, soaked in au jus with giardiniera (Italian relish of pickled vegetables in vinegar or oil). So I looked for an Italian Deli on this side of town.  For some reason I just did not like it, I wish there was more giardiniera because all I could taste was the roast beef with the roll. Maybe I should go to a Chicago place that specializes in these types of sandwiches instead, or perhaps they are just not for me.  Next, I tried their baked goods. A peanut butter cookie, a lemon cookie, a chocolate cookie, a rasberry cookie, a sugar cookie dipped in chocolate and sprinkles, and a coconut cookie. The only cookie I liked was the coconut cookie. I ended up ordering 3 more! The rest simply tasted like shortbread cookies with mild flavoring, the flavors were far too subtle. Some almost tasted the same.  Overall everything was just okay, but the coconut cookies are worth a visit. The staff was friendly and helpful and the bathroom and store was clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cookies clockwise: chocolate, sugar with sprinkles, rasberry with sprinkles, peanut butter, lemon, and coconut in the middle.
Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Italian Beef Sandwich with giardiniera, roast beef, cheese, soaked in au jus.

ygiCPduVu_1yrBejmiOyDA.text: Forget about it... I can't believe I just discovered this place, from a family friend... unbelievable. Clean, friendly, great selection. I couldn't decide on sub, so hot Italian & Pastrami. Italian was very very good, but Pastrami was mind blowing! Place is is must

Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Home made bread

LFBc-hGgafRgFqV0V8xb6Q.text: Great authentic Italian Deli. Reminds me of some Deli's from the east coast. Friendly employees and great customer service. I highly recommend this place for any of your pasta, pastry and Italian meat and cheese needs.

wqrf70N1GsMLQfTZTXhcrA.text: Looking for quality food? This is the place!  Came in and loved looking around. Eventually ordered one of the special subs and a chocolate cannoli. Def one of the best subs I've ever had. Not the biggest sandwich person, but these subs will be worth your buck.   Really helpful and friendly staff. :)

FlQmE0oB0pW7bTpK5GwTIg.text: Romanelli's  Italian Deli has been aound since 1975. Great place for fresh delicacies and sandwiches. Had the Robert's Special on a fresh Italian roll. Sandwich has roast beef, pastrami and cheese with various condiments. Great flavor and the crusty roll makes it complete. Also purchased antipasta salad and cannoli to go.  You can dine in or place an order to go. They also have a large deli selection, pizza and pasta dishes to go. They have a large Italian  grocery section and desserts.  Enjoy dining in, they have seating. Ambience feels like you are far away from Phoenix in somebody's home having a great meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cannoli&#39;s to go!
Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roberts Special with Antipasta

8oB0NzBNSzOxMUWPEvmwfA.text: Coolest Italian market/deli/bakery!  The New Yorker hot pastrami sandwich is my favorite. The Italian stallion is way up there too. The cannolis are awesome. I just bought a jar of the garlic basil pasta sauce, I'm sure it'll be great. Highly recommended local ma and pop shop.

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. New Yorker
Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. New Yorker

vprlCWHs7n_aXMMEkBLl9w.text: This deli is very good. I found it when I moved to Phoenix in 1991. They have great meat, sausages and sandwiches. It's also a nice grocery store for most of it is but not All Italian stuff. This place is so nice and clean everyone is very friendly and helpful. The place has great parking. They also have nice pastries and bread.

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States

x3rFHz2OwJPNBqAVanFptA.text: Stopped by for the first time in close to twenty years and it was better than I remember it being.  The deli sandwiches were as good as any I have had in Philly , Chicago or Kansas City.  All of your Italian specialty foods are available.  They even have decaf espresso.   So stop by have a sandwich in the deli, take home some canoli and enjoy some espresso.

MUDGqMZ95MMYE66WNSEtrg.text: Excellent sandwiches roast beef and cheese was real delicious bread rolls were perfect only minus was too much oil and vinegar made  bottom of bread soggy

Mx473LvVz66hrtcr68_YWA.text: We were in Phoenix for Nationals and decided to come in to grab some lunch.  This popped up on yelp and it was close to the hotel.  It's an old school Italian Deli!!  We ordered ham/cheese sandwich and salami/cheese.  The bread was so soft and delicious.  The sandwich was made with just the right amount of lettuce, Onion and Italian dressing.  We were very satisfied with our meal would come back.  This beats Subway any day.

5iHN6MpSYv7NaBv49JLYdQ.text: After driving by a million times and trying to come when it was closed, we finally made it in and I must say this place absolutely blew us away, everything was done right and done well!  We had the MEATBALL and the "ROBERT," with a side of anti pasta (chunks of salami, cheese, veggies, olives, and artichokes and it was delicious, and the meatballs were juicy and full of flavor).    Afterwords a chocolate CANNOLI which I have to honestly say was the BEST CANNOLI EVER!    This is also a one stop for imported Italian goods (sauces, pastas, clam sauce, pesto, wines, sodas, etc), awesome deli meats, and cheeses, butter cookies, pastries...and well you get it.  We also managed to take a slice of LEMONCELLO MOUSSE CAKE and OOOOOOOO M G!   Last but not least Robert and the staff were very friendly and provided great service!

NWHkTGyIYEw8rF0Unv-5Ig.text: Large selection, I didn't really know what most of the sandwiches were, maybe a description would help and not hold up the line. Prices were a bit high, well they were high. I was charged a mysterious $2 extra. I also think they have an extra charge for debit or I paid $2 in taxes for $9 in baked goodies. It was a great authentic place, but just too many mystery charges. Might not go back as often as I would like, $9 for just a sub is out of my range. That New York cheesecake was delish!!! The hormel ham was just too over priced, I have a small market myself, and $6.99 is just pushing it.

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dry sandwich

5qXzmW4ahIbB8BEmovPSMQ.text: Absolute perfection. Born and raised in CT I have been desperately missing real Italian deli fare. This place hit that mark perfectly. I got the Reuben. Beautifully seasoned, thinly sliced sheets of corned beef layered with fresh coleslaw and housemade thousand island. They've got all the classics- cape cod chips, brioschi lemon soda, pizzelle, and cannoli eclairs and black and whites! Also try the pastrami and order The Robert. This place is gold, I will be back.

i4SiT2W1kPDhi-8hZ8u68w.text: Romanelli's baked a delicious Tiramisu cake for my sister's bridal shower.  It was beautiful and lined with lady fingers to cover sides. It was light with right balance of flavors.  THANK YOU!

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tiramisu Cake (Tower of Pisa not included)

R0PrEVe0eHHdweRpQKbU1A.text: Solid Italian deli / grocer. Chicken parm was the sandwich of choice. While it's a grocery store, it's a little strange they don't have cash register by the deli section where you buy your sandwich.

VNtf5-UGWG7sdUbzIfrGTw.text: Stopped by and picked up a hot pastrami  Sandwich, cold pasta salad and a lemonade. The pastrami sandwich was great! The meat was soft and tender with good flavor. Cold pasta salad was good nothing special. Lemonade out of a regular soda machine. The place looks like a good old family owned restaurant. They have Italian merchandise all over the place.

CthAqWFbKSNOx_vGtQbNRw.text: Best thing going in the Cortez Park area! It's clean, the people are kind, the food is delicious, and they have Gino's East pizza in the frozen food section!

uLSJKh05KyLK9w2f_jeRGw.text: Fabulous sandwiches! We had 6 different types of sandwiches and they were ALL delicious! And the cannoli was the best I've had since we were in Italy!! Yum!

ziTj1A3PdDJHwNbs2RdleA.text: Great little Italian deli. Famiky owned.  Great people who work there.  Awesome sandwichs, pasta salad,  meats, desserts.  Can't go wrong with this place!

vxHNdZI4ZbNZj46trrW7NA.text: Great local Italian deli that is hidden in the back of an Italian grocery store. The food is very authentic and fresh. Also, the desserts are unreal, all kinds of pastries and Italian ice. If you like Italian food, cook with Italian ingredients, or are Italian yourself you need to come here!

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. George&#39;s Sub with hot peppers!

XNizB0wVqLBP_V7lMtntOg.text: When I'm in AZ for the winter, this Jersey girl misses great Italian food, so I asked the guy at the Walmart deli counter at 19th Ave/Bell if he knew of a great Italian deli nearby. He sent me straight to Romanelli's, and I've been going there every winter ever since. I've even thrown spaghetti dinners for my East Coast friends and relatives in Phoenix and all ingredients are from Romanelli's. Their meatballs are divine. I will never make another meatball from scratch again. Their red gravies are also delicious, and so are the breads and cannolis (this coming from someone who visits Little Italy in NYC like its Mecca), so when I'm in Phoenix, I go straight to Romanelli's instead of making it myself from scratch. Sorry Mom!

S_o9YvBZjQINz6e-xAcvmA.text: Mmm mmm mmm!!! So good! This is the kind of old-school, real deal, Italian deli counter that I dream about. I had the lunch combo. 1/2 sandwich and salad. I choose cappicola and provolone and sundried tomatoe salad. It was legit. I ate there for lunch today and already want to go back. The service was great. Everyone there was supper friendlyband makes you feel like family.  Your a True gem in the valley. Thank you for doing what you do!!

zERBFFcjXccd7hY4cfOdXg.text: I lived in the shit hole apartments next door over fifteen years ago. The only reason I lived there as long as I did was romanellies. I would walk next door and get cheap good sandwiches. I have been coming back through the years but seam to forget about it every few years. Then I was driving by yesterday and stopped in.  I have a obsession with pastrami and they did not disappoint. Told the guy to make me a BADASS pastrami sandwich on rye and oh he did work. Fuggedabouit

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pastrami on rye.   Fuggedaboutit

_O9fZvGY_jjYfmDdjA4LMw.text: We love the meatball sub, lasagna and Italian sausages. They are so helpful and have a perfect selection of food and desserts. Customer service is the best I have ever seen.

yp0DNaGm3ISCwjjnsvXWXQ.text: Established in the 70s, matching decor gives it character. The proof of NY style deli is in on the menu. Meat's and cheeses important directly from Italy, both hot & mild Capicola ham. Full selection of pasta's (+gluten free) & sauce's. Staff's friendly & ate knowledgeable pro's.  Usually order the Italian stallion sub, never disappointed until I have to leave. Worth the drive, bring cash.

NowB6_BA5cc2fwVM3oBz4w.text: This is the best Italian store here in AZ!!!  It is just like the ones back home in Chicago.  Only difference is the one back in Chicago that I used to go to (I think it was Gino's in Norridge...) also made calzones, arancinis, etc in their bakery section.  ALL Italian food, fresh made pasta.  And the family there that run the place are awesome!  It's been a while since I've been there but Robert is so helpful.  And they recognize my mom!!!  (After spending a couple hunge.)  Their cannolis and Italian Cassata cake is amazing, as are the rest!!!  If they would make homemade arancinis and fresh calzones they would get 6 stars from me!!!  The sandwiches are pretty good, I'm used to more crusty bread like back home.  Easy to spend more than you intended, but worth every penny!!

ZsChuqFjevjryfispm0OtA.text: Had heard of Romanelli's, but was never on that side of town at the right time to check it out. This time it really worked out. We ordered two sandwiches - Meatball and The George. Both were on 10 inch hoagie rolls.   The meatball was piled high with meatballs, sauce, and cheese. The George was packed with meat and topped with sweet & hot peppers. The bread was fantastic. It was crusty, but not so hard that you could bite into it.  We split a cannoli for dessert. Crunchy and sweet.   I would highly recommend Romanelli's. Worth the trip.  N*joy...

k6S-CCDs6lOadt_qnsu9Ng.text: Romanelli's is the most amazing italian deli that one can ever come across in Phoenix.   It is located down the street from the high school that I went to and we used to stop most days for some cheese pizza or "Italian Stallion" sandwich. Now that I have grown this is a prime place to shop for my own culinary needs such as pastas, cold cuts, pizza toppings, sauces and even hommade pizza dough just waiting to be thawed and used to make your own delicious pizzas.  I still stop in for the occassional sandwish and the "Italian Stallion" is still my top choice. Ham, capicolla,  grnoa salami, pepperoni and provalone cheese piles high with onions thinnly shredded lettuce tomatoes and of course bread soggy with dressing as it should be. And don't forget to follow it up with your favorite italian sweet. I haven't had a bad dessert yet.  The service is prompt and charmingly brusque. A real New York feeling here.   If its authenticity you are after this is your place..anywhere else? Fuggedaboudit!!

ikBnXogGUJQDHCHc1Z8PMw.text: Not sure what all of the hype is about... I would much rather drive to Del Falcos in Tempe/South Scottsdale.  The sauce was rather sweet and the sides were overpriced (over $5 for a small side).  Overall, it's alright.

aLNPcdf903ugGCbbxUOjAQ.text: I like to go here to grab some subs on the way to the river, since it's between our house and the 17. Just because I don't want to go to Subway or Blimpie's.  Mostly, it's a rather expansive Italian market. Need olive oil? They have 20+ different kinds. Pasta? There's a whole aisle. How about one of those wooden thingies for making gnocchi. Got that too.  In the back, a counter runs along the whole length of the back wall. That's where you'll find all sorts of cheeses, cold cuts, and sausauge, plus a few sweets.   It's also where you order sandwiches. And you'd better know exactly what your want, and fast. The man behind the counter is perpetually surly and curt. It gets worse if you stand there and try to make heads or tails of all the hand-written sandwich combinations taped to the wall. Luckily, the woman who runs the cash register is always very sweet. So that kind of makes up for it.  I want to love their sandwiches. I just don't. They're OK. The meat is always really good, there just isn't enough of it. Maybe I'm just not ordering the right things.   Until then, I'll continue to support Romanelli's, but they'll only get a so-so rating for the deli. The product selection, however, is top notch.

6_oO1E4ohvxd_nGp78X13g.text: If you want authentic Italian meats and cheeses in the Valley of the Sun, Romanellis should be your stop.  From the outside, it looks like your basic store in a strip mall, but you walk in and you can see immediately that these people are not fooling around.  Besides the various Italian Pride type of shirts and other tchotchkes, there are aisles of various foods either made at the deli, or shipped in from elsewhere.  Do you need olive oil or pasta? They have plenty of those along with sauces and preserved veggies.  The real draw though is the deli.  Skip the Boars Head branded meats and sandwiches made with them because you can get that anywhere, you want to go for the real meats and cheeses, which are further to the left.  Since there are multiple brands of some items, do not be afraid to ask the person behind the counter which ones are the best.  Highly recommended are the pastrami, hot cappicola, and genoa salami.  Their signature sandwich seems to be the Italian Stallion, which is very very good, but there are are a wide variety of sandwiches that you can pick up.  Besides that they also offer plenty of pasta salad and antipasto to take home, and on the day I went, you could pick up sausage and peppers for your lunch.  The staff itself come from areas like NYC and New Jersey so don't be entirely surprised if they keep things short and sweet, it's nothing personal against you.    There's also a bakery case with various desserts, go for the sfogliatelle and cannoli, they are excellent.

68UexAgqaOa6V2FMJugmlQ.text: Great little place.  They have great sweet treats and their subs are awesome.  Love it!!!

vcY86KzdLZ6iJ0TnhuUWcg.text: Romanelli's makes a good sandwich, I admit. But other than that, I don't see many redeeming qualities.  The two stars is for the fact that they appear to pass off fake Parmigiano-Reggiano as the real thing (check the rinds -- if there isn't an imprint, it's not legit). And at around $18/pound, that's a shady thing to do. They also sell Garofalo pasta for $5/pound, which you can buy at Costco for $12 -- and for that price you get 8 pounds. Also: skip the cannoli. They taste like they just added a little vanilla to a can of Betty Crocker frosting for the filling.  But they do have several good olive oils that aren't absurdly marked up, as well as my favorite, La Valle San Marzano canned tomatoes which are only a buck or two more than you can find elsewhere. They also sell Maestri Pastai (a very good pasta), but at AJ's prices (although to be fair, Romanelli's and AJ's are the only two stores in the city who sell the brand).  So, go in for a sandwich, but I can't recommend much else other than the aforementioned few items.

6skD0HbzX8uOYGTO_FfcAw.text: Went back and picked up the best canolis I've ever had along with some delicious NY Cheesecake, Romanelli's pasta sauce, imported pasta, Wise potato chips and Italian cookies.    It is now very clear to me that you absolutely cannot go wrong at this place.  I'm comfortable trying anything and everything there.  I would go every day if I could.  Great food, Italian grocery, deli, etc.

tmS4mX3Dk8i8rZqOZrC9UQ.text: Great sandwich, great grocery store, incredible desserts, friendly people, kinda rundown location.

YkV4Q4GmNfSdPjtKQdAadQ.text: LOVE THE SUBS AND DESSSERTS! Fast friendly service everything is delicious my favorite is their cheesecake hubby loves their limoncello also delicious pizza great I like the variety in drinks keeps it interesting ok I LOVE EVERYTHING!

IODnimLfll5ijkArZoLWeg.text: I head to Romanelli's for their deli section and eat in .... their food is fantastic.  True Italian food ... no one I've been there with has been disappointed.  Make sure you come hungry because portions are BIG and you will leave stuffed.  They also have a huge assortment of grocery items (ie - pasta sauce, pasta, etc)

XCKCju1g4n9ZZPxMr3_hDQ.text: Have been here a couple of times now.  Had a craving for an italian sub the other day so roomy and I stopped in.  While trying to figure out what we wanted, the guy behind the counter started telling us about some of the hot entrees they had in addition to the sandwiches.  Italian sausage with onions and peppers, lasagna, veal parm and something else.  He gave us samples of the sausage.  OMG!  Incredible flavor.  He definitely was making our decision harder.  Chose George's special and we decided to get some fresh hot italian sausage from the meat counter along with some fresh parm to take home for dinner.    We, like another reviewer were supposed to be coming here for a sandwich and we walked out with so much more.  I love to cook so we walked out with pasta, the fresh sausage, hunk of parm, fresh garlic bread, black and white cookie (huge and yummy), a fabulously thick and robust tomato sauce with onion and peppers.  Think the baked ziti I made with these ingredients was the best by far.  When making italian, no more grocery items, coming here instead.  If you're looking for a great italian deli/grocer, etc, you gotta try this place.

Tsy9tCXJQLtSKfIpaqnUAw.text: I have lived around this place for 10 years and always drove past it without a glance. The area looks sketchy so I never gave this place a 2nd thought. It wasn't until reading reviews online that I decided I have to give this place a shot. As a foodie, I can't believe I haven't discovered this place earlier! They have imported cheeses, meats, italian desserts, san marzano tomatoes, and they make sandwiches too! The sandwiches are good, but I think the bread is too big and tough to eat- but at least it won't get soggy easily. My boyfriend specially requested a salami and turkey sandwich and they rang us at no extra cost like Subway does. Considering this is a specialty food store, the prices are comparable to a regular grocery store PLUS it's a family owned local place. Can't beat that!

LVGyOOYfx_EXOY7sbntHyw.text: I used to live in Chicago and until Romanelli's, I haven't found a good italian beef sandwich. When I took my first bite I was brought back to so many memories. I've had a few other sandwiches here and there hasn't been anything bad. Not to mention the amazing desserts. Definitely the place to go for great food from back east. Love it!

KxXuS-HkqlDjwBYFETuamw.text: This place is amazing! Excellent food and wonderful service. Huge assortment of meats and cheeses.

n7W98SvNxGBAc1O95HTBSA.text: From the outside you might be unsure about going in to eat, but please do. This is an amazing little market/ deli/ restaurant all rolled into one. The store is very user friendly & is easy to find items you are looking for, if for some reason you can't find it the staff is more than willing to help & give suggestions if needed. The deli is great, good fresh bread & meat. I love the dressing they put on the sandwiches. The pastas, hot or cold are great as well. It's fast and easy to get in and out if you are in a hurry.

w-_ufkuqGjwk_6VxOHhOhQ.text: I'm amazed that this place is in Phoenix. It carries rare and hard to find products from Italy as well as in-house made Italian products. House sausages are insane, the deli is truly supherb. Feels like a slice of New York in the desert.

r3OR73p5Bh0-zE7fJ6NB8Q.text: Can't wait to have a real reason to go back here. We were doing a foodie market tour today and this was suggested as our last stop( my buddy Tom had to take home fresh cannolis home to the womenfolk). My plan is to go back for delicious sub sandwiches since this place is close to work . Why haven't gotten lunch here already ?  They have great Italian grocery supplies like the Stella Dora cookies I remember as a kid living in Jersey.  I also perused the San Marino tomatoes and pondered the differences from "regular" canned tomatoes. At 7.00 bucks a can I guess I won't ever know. I rather spend my money on baked goodies in the front case. My husband , the wonderful Michael  surprised me with a eclair . You know he loves me!

A5YThzQ2q1qPidlVNoHSoQ.text: Ifind it hard to belive that I have worked around the corner from this place for tthe past two year but have never come inside.... well I have gone two times this week so far! The desserts are truly amazing and so far I have had two turkey subs and e desserts. The subs both were a little dry so you have to make sure and tell them to put plenty of condiments on it, unless you like it that way. They are all so friendly there, and they have anything you can image italian including pizza dough balls and fresh pasta ready to be cooked. While in line to check out I saw that they even sell pasta making machines! If you haven't been here or are thinking of checking it..don't hesitate. Just go! You will be happy you did :)

apbjOakJ303RwEhVLzdjwA.text: Wow, went to Romanelli's today for the first time, this place not only smells fantastic, the food is awesome!  Do not wait, go there....now!  I had the Italian sub, it was wonderful and only $4.95 for a half, which is plenty for one person.

dVuWX5kE9zUYItyjRhozrg.text: My uncle ordered one of their party subs for the Super Bowl. It was their italian sub, with capicolla, salami, ham, pepperoni, and provelone. It was FANTASTIC! I am a sucker for italian subs, but picky when it comes to the quality. This was perfect. I will definitely be going there myself to see what their other dishes tastes like.

UKhrqafNT76EaMvXXDH3yA.text: OMG the smell when you walk in the door! Totally starving. Drove a long way because I don't live in the area anymore. I brought my nieces with me who are here on summer break. Everyone is friendly.  We got greeted when we walked in with a "good morning ladies" and "what can I get for you today" as we approached the deli. We ended up doing a little grocery shopping (they have specialty groceries) . Ended up sharing a sub and trying a few of the pasta sides. Deli was clean, everyone wore gloves and were understanding when it took some time for the kids to decide what they wanted. That's a big deal to me.  My girls wanted cookies (5 and 7 years old)  We started off with a few selections and ended up with a box... ;0 ... lady behind the counter was so patient with them when they asked what was in the cookies about a hundred times. On the way out we ended up with cannoli's as well.  Really nice feel to the place. I would definitely recommend.

XmkGI6ohz4z5UXBkb8NcGw.text: Love this place. Generous portions and great service. My boyfriend and I can split a sandwich and a pickle, were stuffed. The New Yorker or meatball is the way to go, although I've never had anything I didn't like.

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The New Yorker.

QcaPv5nL8EqyCA7KujN1eg.text: A Rare Find.Thank You.Late Afternoon On Tuesday January 2,2018 Marked my Third Visit to pick up a to go order. Amazing all the way across the board from start to finish.Fine example of Customer Service The way it used to be and nice to know it still exists.Starting with my initial phone call to place my order, on all three occassions the Gentleman who answered the phone was efficient and friendly.Upon arrival I was Politely Greeted by Down to Earth Staff.The overall atmosphere was Inviting,The Store was incredibly clean and seemed well stocked with inventory.The folks in the deli preparing the food were friendly and energetic.The Cashier also pleasant and down to earth treated me with respect.The food amazing.I ordered two Lasagna Dinners one with Meatballs and one With Sausage as well as a slice of Cheesecake,Tiramisu,and The Lemon cello Desserts.Wow!So Delicious.

uNjwEKEe6ptKyuXzou7sog.text: Went for the first time today and will definitely be going back!!! This is real authentic italian! Absolutely delicious sandwich!  The cannoli is also out of this world! This place is a diamond in the rough as its not located in the best area. Its also a mini store, selling other items. Don't expect to eat in with a super large group as there may not be enough tables but you can order to go and I also read that they cater. If you are looking for one of the best italian sandwiches, give this place a try.

YOPQGoxUnIT_jcBZ4MHcOw.text: This is a solid sandwich, and when I'm in the area I will swing by again if in the mood for a sub.  I am still on the hung for the amazing bread I miss so much when I lived in Santa Monica at "Bay Cities Italian Deli".  I was hopeful for Romanelli's after reading the reviews, but not even close.  "Ike's For Love Of Sanwiches" is pretty good, but still not the same as "Bay Cities" in Santa Monica.  If anyone knows of a deli with amazing rolls, please let me know!  Romanelli's has good meat and also "Parma" prosciutto, which can be hard to find in many delis.  They have a good selection of meats, cheeses, salads, and hot items.  They have both cold & hot subs available for purchase at pretty good prices.  My sub was $7 and it was huge; like 14".  It fed me twice, and was even better after it sat and soaked up all the flavors for 2 or 3 hours.  Check it out if your in the area and are in the mood for a solid sub!

photos.caption: Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Romanelli's Italian Deli - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House Sub

vgsMQuAlF7TzcJgqIBOT8A.text: If you want a nice sandwich this is a decent sandwich deli. The hot food on the cart out front looks disgusting. Does it really need to be in the aisle? At least let me pretend it seems fresher and hide it behind the counter. They have a lot stuff in the shelves but i never see to much go out the door. The cannoli and other pasty in the case have always satisfied but no chocolate dipped cannoli when i really wanted one. Had to do with a standard one but they always please either way. With a few dollars and an overhaul they could make some more $$. But is kinda grubby and the staff is okay.  Try to get the soda in my cup and less than 3/4 icet. Parking is terrible. Do yourself a favor get yourself a cold sub to go and skip the ambience.

auPwNrf6lrdETnPqxbT0MA.text: Omg.   The subs here are money.   I love this place   We stumbled upon it one afternoon and it's now one of our favorites

YlYbUTk_-JXcxYTn_tlvKg.text: This is probably my favorite sandwich shop!  Everything is fresh, made to order. Sandwiches are amazing, pasta is amazing, pastries are amazing, people are amazing. Wish they were open later, I'd eat here way more often!!!   My go to is the Italian stallion!

JdUDNvs_Xm2AxWRcfURDew.text: First time trying this place out and this won't be our last!  Best, I mean best cannolis I've ever tried. I've tried many from all over the US and I can say theirs is so good! Their hot pastrami sandwich hit the spot with crusted Italian bread. You won't be disappointed.
